Strong the muscles a second at the end of the extension to recruit as many muscle fibers as possible.

This insulation exercise is not intended to be executed with heavy loads.It is best to choose a load that will allow you to perform at least 10 repetitions with good technique and in all the amplitude of movement.

To keep a maximum of tension on the triceps, avoid leaning too much forward, do not place your shoulders above the bar or do not escape your elbows.Otherwise, you would involve your pectoral your muscles, which is normally sought after on an insulation movement.
Take advantage of the possibility of quickly changing the load to make degreases Debressivesafin to club your triceps.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the bird with elastic.

How to make the bird with elastic?: 1: Standing, feet apart from the width of the shoulders, arms along the body, hold a strip in pronation (the thumbs pointing to each other).

3: Inspire and spread the elastic by contracting your posterior deltoids.
4: Return slowly to the starting position.
5: Repeat this movement until you have made the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: It is ideally necessary to focus on posterior deltoids, not on scapular retractors, and therefore limit movements to the scapula.Move the shoulder in the joint, not the scapula on the rib cage.
Keep the abdominals contracted and do not stop the back during the execution of the movement.Always maintain a slight knee bending.

Choose an elastic band that allows you to make the movement on a complete amplitude.If the elastic is too thick, resistant and prevents you from making a complete movement, the exercise will have a reduced interest.
The elastic must be stretched from the start of the movement.You can take a fine elastic and do a few laps to find the right resistance.
The rhythm of training must be very slow and controlled, avoiding fast and jerky movements.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with Rowing at the Smith Machine.

How to drive at the Smith Machine?: 1: Sit in the Smith Machine, just in front of the bar, the feet apart from the width of Executive.
2: Enter the bar with the shoulder width or slightly wider.

3: Pick up the rack bar and put your body in the starting position by leaning slightly forward from the basin, the trunk being tilted forward at an angle of approximately 45 degrees compared to the hips.
4: From the starting position, pull the bar up, towards your stomach.
5: Tighten the shoulder blades and voluntarily contract the upper back muscles when you arrive at the top of the movement.
6: Then go down slowly in the starting position, until you feel a slight stretch of the upper back muscles.

Training advice: Keep the muscles of the abdominal strap and lower back well contracted throughout the movement and make sure that the lower back remains in a neutral or natural position (do not round it).

When you do the rowing at the helm, one of the main questions that arise is how far you should look.There are many variants of the leaning position, the hanging position completely leaning at almost 90 degrees, including the Yates 45 degree position where the torso is more vertical.

An error to avoid is to stand too straight.When your upper body is tilted forward at 45 degrees, it remains a movement of Rowing, but it is not an uptop or a vertical movement.Nevertheless, many people do this exercise by standing almost entirely standing.This is a technical error, because it reduces the amplitude of movement for an exercise that already does not have much.

With the inverted socket (in supination), the bicepssont placed in a favorable position and also contribute to the movement.Your elbows will naturally be directed backwards (the elbows will not evade on the sides as is the case during a rowing with a pronation).

In addition to the position of the hands (in pronation or in supination), the width of the socket represents additional variants.However, this exercise is preferably done with the grip of the shoulders or slightly wider.If your socket is too narrow, you may feel greater tension in the wrists.A too narrow socket also requests biceps too much and reduces the amount of weight that you can lift with the back muscles.If you enter the bar with an overly wide socket, you will simply further reduce the amplitude of movement.Just as you can do with hand positions in pronation or supination, if you experience different socket widths, you may find the most comfortable, which reduces tension on the joints or that allows youto obtain the highest contraction of the upper back muscles.

Whatever variant you use, it is better to do this exercise while respecting a very strict technique and leaving aside your ego.Although rowing is considered to be a compound “heavy” composed, it is preferable to do it with a strict technique and a strong spirit-muscle connection.

image_src_note.caption: Bulgarian squat muscles with dumbbells.

How to make the Bulgarian squat?: 1: Mettez-vous en position debout en tenant des dumbbells sur le côté avec une prise neutre.
2: Place the rear foot on a bench or platform to increase the amplitude of movement.
3: The right bust or slightly tilted forward, descend by bending the front knee and continue until your front thigh is almost horizontal.
4: Ideally, the angle between the leg and the thigh forms a right angle in the low position.
5: You can squat a little more, but do not let your knee touch the ground.Hold this low position for a moment.
6: Push with the front foot and lengthen your leg to return to the starting position.
7: Repeat the exercise until reaching the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: Ideally, the foot in support on the bench should be placed up to the knee or slightly below.If you place the rear foot too high, you may cause an excessive extension of your lumbar column.
If you want to emphasize the quadriceps during leg bending, slightly retreat the front foot.Conversely, if you want to focus on glutes and hamstrings, increase the length of the step.

Check that your feet are always removed from the width of the hips, or even slightly more.Your raised foot must not be aligned directly behind your front foot, because it would then be much more difficult to balance.You may have to hop or move your front foot to find a safe and stable placement.
Remember that your rear foot is only there to help you balance.The movement and effort of the exercise are made on the front leg.

As with all variants of squat and slit, a frequent and not negligible error during the Bulgarian squat is to let the knee front move inward or outside, losing the alignment with the toes on the same side.This exerts too much pressure on the knee, especially during the exercises to one leg, where the weight and the resistance are supported by a single leg.

image_src_note.caption: Muscles requested at the Overhead Shrug.

How to make the overhead shrug?: 1: With the feet apart from the width of the shoulders, lift a bar above your head.Keep your arms well stretched.
2: Keeping with your arms stretched and your back straight, exhale, raising your shoulders as high as possible.
3: Hold this position for two seconds and contract the upper trapezoid muscles.
4: Inhale by slowly lowering your shoulders.
5: Repeat this movement until you have made the number of repetitions planned.

Training advice: Be sure to wind your thumbs well around the bar so that it does not slip and does not fall on your head.Never use an inch (suicide grip) socket for this exercise.
Keep Vosabdomineaungés and your neutral back throughout the exercise.
The bar should be placed directly above your head throughout the exercise.
For your safety, start with a light load and gradually increase as your strength increases.
Limit the momentum you could give with your legs, as well as the jerky movements or the excessive rebounds of the bar.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the Zercher Carry.

How to do the Zercher Carry?: 1: Chargez une barre olympique posée sur un rack à squat au niveau despectoraux(comme le montre la vidéo ci-dessous).
2: Take the bar in the hollow of your elbows and keep them in a high position.
3: Walk by contracting your abs as if you were going to punch in your stomach.
4: Walk for a determined distance or time, then rest the bar on the squat rack.

Training advice: When you prepare to lift the bar, be sure to take a deep inspiration so as to fix the position of Vospaules.The weight will cause scapular depression in your shoulders.You must therefore make sure that your shoulders are well positioned before lifting the weight.

Avoid leaning back.Try keeping your chest as right as possible.The goal is to strengthen deep muscles.If you lean back, you will support the load with yourdoset the abdominal muscles will not be asking as much.
Lightly raise the shoulders.Not to the point of no longer being in a neutral position, but just enough to compensate for the weight that pulls your shoulders down.
Walk at a controlled pace.Going too fast in principle leads to a deterioration of the technique.
Walk slowly and make sure you have a heel-head scheme.
Continue to breathe throughout the exercise and do not rely on breathing to stabilize your spine.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested at the Sumo Squat with Landmine.

How to make the SUMO SQUE at LANDMINE?: 1: Stay standing up, feet discussed about twice the width of the shoulders, facing one of the ends of a bar installed in fixing the Landmine.
2: Your toes should be directed outside.
3: Croupe yourself and enter the bar with both hands.
4: Straightening yourself while keeping your back straight and the high chest.
5: Make the number of rehearsals planned.

Training advice: You can let the bar touch the floor during your descent since the amplitude of the movement is not very large.
As with all leg bending movements, avoid rounding your back.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked for the developed to the ground.

How to do the developed to the ground?: 1: Sit on the floor and roll the bar on your legs until the center of the bar is above your hips.Lie, fold your knees and put your feet flat on the ground.
2: Take the bar with a slightly larger socket than the shoulder width and place your elbows at an angle of 45 degrees compared to your body.
3: Lift your hips as if you were doing a bridge with your buttocks to get the bar over your elbows.Your forearms must be perpendicular to the ground.
4: Pass the bar over your chest until your arms are completely extended.
5: Slowly lower the bar to your chest until your elbows touched the floor, keeping your arms at an angle of about 45 degrees compared to your body.
6: Take a break with the elbows on the ground for 1 or 2 seconds, then perform the following rehearsal.
7: At the end of the series, place the bar on the bottom of your belly and the top of your hips, where you started to move it.

Advice for the developed to the ground: Do not use too heavy loads, as moving the bar to the position above Vospectoralsn is not without risk.Indeed, this maneuver forces the shoulders to make an abduction and a protraction, two movements at risk for this joint in this context.

There is no need to lie on something very soft and you have to rely on a surface as firm as possible, but you can consider placing a yogaentre you and the ground.If you are developing on the floor in a gym, the floor can grate your bare skin (especially if you wear a tank top).

Most people will not be able to slip under a bodybuilding bar or move it safely.If you do a developed to the ground without a training partner, do not force yourself to make this movement with a bar.The dumbbells and leskettles bring excellent results and are much easier to implement.You can place them on your knees and wear them on your shoulders in a sitting position, then lying down gently with the weights already in place.

You may be more comfortable with your extended legs flat during movement.You can also find easier to reproduce a developed position lying with the bent knees and the feet flat on the ground.One or the other of these positions are suitable for this exercise.Whatever the starting position you are using, make sure you drive your feet into the ground during movement.This will help you keep your bust engaged.If your legs are tense, you will have to press your heels on the ground.If your knees are folded and your feet are anchored in the ground, just make sure your fessiers, not take off from the ground.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with hip extensions to GHD.

How to make hip extensions to GHD?: 1: Take a moment to settle on the bench properly for more comfort and efficiency before starting your series.
2: Your hips must be on the verge of GHD with well -wedged feet.
3: Cross your hands in front of your chest (basic version) or place them behind your head, a prisoner manner (more advanced version).
4: Keeping your head high and right back (neutral position of the spine), lower your upper body until the angle of your hips is close to 90 degrees (the top and the bottom of your bodyform an L).
5: From the low position, make an extension of the hips to return to the starting position.
6: Do not exceed the parallel position on the ground (you should not have a hyperextension of the lower back).
7: Tighten the glutes at the top of the movement and maintain the position during a fraction of a second if you want to obtain a maximum contraction.

Training advice: This exercise is most often carried out according to a rocking movement of the basin aimed at activating the hamstrings and the glutes as strongly as possible.To do this, you must settle on the bench properly so as to be suspended from the top of the thighs, exactly as on the illustration above.This is the position that allows you to flex and then extend the articulation of the hips, an action which best recruits your hamstrings and your glutes.
You should feel strong tension in the hamstrings, as well as stretching when you reach the bottom of the movement.At the top of the movement, you should feel a strong contraction in the glutes.

Many bodybuilding rooms do not have a GHD, but most of them have a 45 -degree bench.Doing this exercise at an angle of 45 degrees is a little easier, but remains an interesting version, so if you do not have a horizontal bench, go to the 45 degree version.Note that if you started on the lumbar extension bench at 45 degrees, the transition to the horizontal bench is a real progression: it is more difficult due to the effect of gravity.
The body weight is sufficient for most beginners, but confirmed athletes and practitioners generally add weight as the force increases, rather than making a greater number of repetitions.

Hip extensions to GHD can be carried out with a single leg at a time (unilaterally).This variant is extremely demanding, which is why most people start by making this movement with two feet fixed under the cushion, and go to the version to one leg that after having obtained a sufficient level of force.For the unilateral version, you will have to anchor a single leg under the cushion and let the other leg (foot) rest slightly on the top of the cushion, which obliges the fixed leg to do all the work.

If you want to use advanced techniques, repetitions with maximum contraction are very interesting.Just keep the position high and contract your glutes, at least for a second, but you can maintain the high position for 1 to 3 seconds.This makes the exercise much more difficult (and therefore also limits the weight you can use).

If you deliberately want to involve the lower back more, you can go back on the cushion so that the bottom of your size is sustained, then you can use a spine extension movement rather than a movement ofBasin of the basin, in order to allow additional dynamic solicitation of the lower back muscles.

name: Curl au pupitre à la pulley

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked for the lying delictopped, the king's exercise for the training of pectorals.

How to do the bench press?.title: Go under the bar
content: As with bodybuilding all -time, a good starting position is imperative to properly make a movement and the bench is no exception.When you lie on the bench, make sure your buttocks, your top of your head are all in contact with the bench.Align your eyes on the bar and make sure your neck is positioned in a neutral manner to avoid injuries.

How to do the bench press?.title: Feet
content: There are several positions of “acceptable” feet, which each require that your feet be firmly anchored on the ground.You will certainly have to test what is best for youranatomy, but here are the two that are the most practiced.

content.caption: On the left a neutral position, on the right a position used in competition

content: In no case should you keep your feet in the air or on the bench as we often see.This prevents you not only from using the force of the legs, but you will also lose a large part of your stability.These two elements are necessary to correctly execute the movement and allow you to progress.

If the bench is not suitable for your size or if you do not have the mobility necessary to keep your feet on the ground, place a few boards under your feet to give you a stable surface on which you can rely.

How to do the bench press?.title: Hand position and barrier
content: Like the position of the feet, the position of the hands is very personal and depends on several factors such as Lamorphology, the history of injuries, the shoulder/wrist mobility and the objectives you have.

details: I recommend that most people adopt a comfortable (medium) hand from hands with a bellied developed.The wider socket is generally used by powerlifters in competition.

That said, whatever the choice you will make to hold the bar, you should also make sure that your wrists are in a neutral position rather than in hyper-extension, as it exerts a large constraint on the joint.

How to do the bench press?.title: Be well shelved!
content: It may be one of the most important steps, because it can allow you to succeed or fail the developed.This is also the step that most people are neglecting.Holding the bar well and being ready to push will help you warn injuries, stabilize Vosepauleset to make the most of the movement.Here are a few tips :
Pull your shoulder blades behind (and down if you tend to raise your shoulders).
Literally do as if you were trying to stretch the bar in length.This will further activate the dorsals and other back muscles.
Blocked your musclesabdominal, gluteal and buttheets contracting them very much.Remember that this is an exercise requesting the whole body!
If you are a beginner, do these steps with a vacuum bar until you are used to it.

How to do the bench press?.title: Take out the rack bar
content: It is always better to get help to take out the rack bar.Some bench developed benches have their bar too high or too low.Too low leads to a loss of force because you must first stretch your arms to be in the starting position.Too high, your shoulders stand out from the bench to grab the bar.So ask someone to help you get the bar so that your shoulders stay back.

How to do the bench press?.title: How to properly develop the load?

details: To stay stable for the duration of the movement, it is essential to use breathing to help you.Before going down the bar, be sure to take a great inspiration and hold it back.This can be done either before removing the bar, or just after having removed it and before starting to get it down.This technique will help you produce strong tension all over your body when you go down the bar to your chest.

There are several ways to expire and the one you will use will depend on your goals and experience.One of the ways is to expire at the top of each repeater when the bar is stable, which allows you to resume another big breathing before descending the bar.You can also expire slowly through your pinched lips when you push the bar up.If you can and have a good level, you can hold your breathing on several rehearsals.
The whole body must remain shelved throughout the movement.You must constantly ensure that you maintain the tension of your backbones, back muscles, abdominals, glutes and quadriceps.
Keeping the abs, buttocks and legs well contracted is the simplest thing.
Always go down the bar to the chest to keep good flexibility and mobility.Depending on your anatomy, the bar should be somewhere towards your nipples.

details.caption: Crédit photo © Alan Thrall Untamed Strength
Crédit photo © Alan Thrall Untamed Strength

details: Note: It is also very important to keep your head on the bench throughout the movement to protect your cervical column.Often, people whose shoulders are not very mobile and the muscles of the weakened nape of the neck take out their bench heads when they grow.To avoid more or less long -term injury, reduce the load until you have a movement with good technique.

How to do the bench press?.title: Go up the bar with the whole body!
content: Just before the bar touches your chest, start growing up by transferring the force from the ground.As you start to push, put your feet firmly on the floor by pushing hard with the heels and pushing your toes at the front of your shoes.You will need to feel your quadriceps, your glutes and your abdominal strap contracted, which will give you more strength to develop the bar.
Continue to push to the high position, without forgetting to keep your shoulder blades tight back and without your shoulders starting to get closer.
You are now ready to do a bench press!

I hope these technical tips will not only help you progress quickly, but also to avoid injuries for the years to come.Once the technique has been mastered, you can continue to add weights on the bar and you challenge with new PRs!

6 variants of the bench.caption: Developed to the ground with Kettlebell

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at Handstand Push-up.

How to do the Handstand Push-Up?: 1: Balance yourself, your hands at a distance of 15 to 30 cm from the wall, the arms apart from the width of the shoulders, the feet attached and the hands oriented forward (or slightly turned out of 5 to10 degrees).

2: Lower your body by moving your shoulders forward and keeping your head straight.Your elbows should be behind and not on the sides.The upper part of your arms must be roughly parallel to the ground at the bottom of the movement.
3: By making sure to keep the body right, go back to the starting position and repeat this sequence until you have made the number of repetitions desired.

Training advice: You should keep the body straight throughout the movement.If you should bend your back, it may be due to a total lack of body control and shoulder force.
You should keep your elbows back and near your body.This allows you to move your body forward and avoid shoulder injury.
You can also use a bar panellette (parallel bars) which will allow you to work with a greater amplitude of motion, but it also requires more strength.
To progress, you can do this exercise in an isometric way, or with the help of a training partner that will help you go up.
For security reasons, it is recommended to make 2 or 3 series to a few rehearsals before failure, but if you have a more advanced level, you can go as far as failure.

Training advice.caption: It is possible to use a wall and the momentum of the legs to make the Handstand Push-up.
If you want to intensify the Handstand Push-up, it is possible to make it with two benches or solidly anchored chairs in order to increase the amplitude of motion.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted in dips on a chair.

How to make the dips on a chair?: 1: Sit on the edge of the chair or bench and place your hands on the edge of the chair or bench.Your legs are extended, the heels touching the ground.Look straight ahead by raising your chin.
2: Keep the chair firmly, then bring your body forward until your bust passes in front of the chair.
3: Fold your arms to slow your body slowly.
4: Then go back to the strength of your triceps, pushing firmly with your hands.
5: Repeat this movement to the number of repetitions planned.

Training advice: It is important not to go too low.Your shoulders should not go lower than your elbows.If you descend below, the joints of your shoulders are subjected to a strong constraint.
Always keep your glutes near the bench so as not to create joint tension at the shoulders.
Contract the triceps at the top of the movement, but do not lock your elbows.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with crunch with vertical legs.

How to make the crunch with vertical leg: 1: Lie a carpet or another comfortable surface on ledossur.
2: Place your hand -crossed hands behind your neck.
3: Raise the legs by putting them perpendicular to the ground, with the slightly folded knees.Keep the bottom of your spine flat on the ground.

4: Start by slowly raising your upper body, lifting your shoulder blades from the ground.Exhale during this rise movement.Keep your legs straight and directed upwards;Do not let them swing or bow to the side.
5: Continue to raise your body up using your abdominal muscles.
6: When your shoulder blades no longer touch the floor, take a break and hold the position for a moment.
7: Then lower the upper body slowly.Inspire during this descent movement.

Training advice: Avoid pulling your head or neck to take off Vospaulesdu Sol.Keep your chin raised when lifting your upper body.
Do not let your legs swing and do not let them fall on the ground.
The descent must be slow and controlled.
The movement must come from a contraction of the abs, and not from a swing from the upper body forward.

name: Developed bench held tight at the Smith Machine

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the bellied developed tightly taken in the Smith machine.

How to make the bellied developed tightl: 1: Adjust the bar of the Smith Machine to the size.
2: Place a flat bench under the middle of the bar.
3: Lie the bench to Platdossur.The bottom of your chest should be directly under the bar.
4: Enter the bar with a supination and width of Vosepauleset Detach the support bar.
5: Complete your arms completely shamelessly locking your elbows.This is the starting position.
6: By inspiring and keeping the elbows near the sides, slowly lower the bar until it touches your chest.
7: Return to the starting position exploding in a strong exhale.Be sure to push with your triceps.
8: Take a break and contract your triceps at the top of the movement.
9: Repeat the movement until you have made the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: To maximize the commitment of the triceps, be sure not to spread your elbows as you would during a conventional lying developed.
Many people bounce the bar on their chest when they lift heavy loads.Avoid: using a rebound or momentum reduces tension on your triceps and exposes you to a greater risk of injury.

The appropriate placement of the hands is of paramount importance during the execution of a tight -in -tight -up developed.If you hold the bar too wide, you train a more important recruitment of the pectorals, and if you enter the bar with an overly narrow socket compared to the width of the shoulders, you will exercise unnecessary tension on your wrists and your forearms.So be sure to hold the bar on the shoulders.
A training partner can help you surpass yourself, to exploit advanced training techniques such as the forced representations and the negative, all more securely.

By performing this variant of the bench press, you must make sure that your shoulder blades are well retracted.If your shoulder blades are not properly positioned, you impose a constraint on your rotator headdresses, which can cause shoulder pain.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the developed with elastic.

How to do the developed with elastic?: 1: Place the elastic under the bench on which you are going to lie down.
2: With flat back and feet firmly anchored on the ground, grab the handles on both sides.
3: Move your hands upwards, completely stretching your arms while resisting the tension of the elastic bands.
4: Then flex the elbows and lower the hands to your chest by controlling the movement.
5: Perform the desired number of rehearsals by maintaining a good technique throughout the exercise.

Training advice: Be sure to have the same strip length on each side.If one side is longer than the other, the latter will benefit from a lower tension or strength of resistance.
Take the time to contract your pectoral muscles at the top of the movement.
Do not let the elastic bands shoot you uncontrolled.
Inspire during the descent and exhale during the ascending phase of the movement to maintain regular breathing.
This exercise offers the possibility of working unilaterally.Do not hesitate to test.

name: Extension des calves assis à la machine

image_src_note.caption: Les muscles sollicités aux extensions des calves assis à la machine.

Comment faire les extensions des calves: 1: Take a place on the machine and place the soles of your feet on the platform with your toes pointed out.Your heels will naturally hang backwards.Place the bottom desquadrip under the kneeling and grip the handles above with your hands.
2: Extension of the ankles and release the safety bar.
3: Abaissez les talons en dorsifléchissant les chevilles jusqu’à ce que les calves soient complètement étirés.
4: Start the ankles and exhale by bending the calves.
5: Repeat this movement to the number of repetitions fixed.

Training advice: Make slow and controlled rehearsals.Limit the momentum and take a break at the top to accentuate the contraction.
To maximize the muscular development of the muscles of the calves, vary the orientation of the toes inward and the exterior to accentuate the effort on different muscle fibers.
Limit the descent of the heels if you feel any stretch of the sole of the foot during the exercise.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested at the rotation of the suspended abdominals.

How to rotate suspended abdominals?: 1: Enter a traction bar and hang with your hands a little wider than the shoulder width, completely tense legs.Make sure your body is straight and the legs remain attached.This is the initial position.

2: Start by flex your hips then raise your legs vertically.Pivot your legs to your right side within the limit of your mobility and strength.Contract your obliques and your abs and then rotate on the opposite side.
3: Perform the desired number of rehearsals.
4: Slowly lower your hips to return to the initial position and finish your series.

Advice for suspended abdominal rotations: Avoid any momentum and master the movement of your hips, knees and abdominals throughout the exercise.
Do not perform this exercise if you have back problems.
You should not normally feel significant tension in the column.If the feeling of stretching felt is unpleasant or painful, simply reduce the amplitude of rotation.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with the Assault Air Bike.

How to use the Assault Air Bike?: 1: Setting of the seat in height: An important thing to adjust the seat is to ensure that the tip of your foot is on the pedal, and not the heel on the pedal.From there, when you install your seat, the front of your foot must be the only thing on the pedal and your leg should not be locked at the bottom of the revolution.This position will help you develop the maximum power of your legs at the bottom of the revolution.

2: Deep seat adjustment: Placement of the seat depends completely on each person.If you place the headquarters more forward compared to the pedals, you will work more with Lesquadripsets if you place the seat further back, you will work more with the posterior (hamstiff) chain.Test with different seat positions and find what suits you best.

3: Sit straight: you should not look like Notre-Dame's hunchback when you practice this cardio exercise.This vertical position will not only facilitate the air inlet into your body, but will also give you a much larger amplitude of motion to push and pull the handles if you were leaning forward.

Training advice: One important thing is not to let the knees go outward.It is very common to see people spread their knees at the top of the round, but that does not allow you to apply the force directly to the bike.Rather try to keep the knee aligned with the foot, avoiding spreading the knees or having them oscillate.An important swing generally means that you use your arms too much, and therefore that the knees vacillate which makes you lose the power of your legs.

If you try to use only your upper body during an Assault Bike session, you will quickly exhaust yourself.So do not neglect the work of the legs.Your arms must push and pull while pushing the pedals with your quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes and calves.The assault bike is designed for an intensive effort.You want to consume as many calories as possible in a minimum of time.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the Hops skater.

How to make the Hops skater?: 2: Move your weight so as to stand on your right foot while squatting slightly and swinging your arms down in front of you and to the right.
3: By squatting and swinging your arms to the right, you ask your buttocks so that you can then jump with your right leg to the left and land on the left leg.
4: Keep the bust forward when you jump and land.Balance your arms lightly up and across your body to help you propel the jump.

5: When you land on your left leg, put yourself in the bending position, pushing your buttocks back to solicit your buttocks to help you jump to the right.Your arms must also swing to the left to help you not only balance yourself, but also to make the next jump.
6: Then push on your left leg and jump to the right, landing on your right foot and returning to a slightly bent position.

Training advice: Make sure you have enough space to jump from side to side.
Beginners may have to go more slowly and do not jump too far on each side.
Place the body weight on the middle of the foot and not on the heels.
Do not round Ledospour avoid lumbar injuries.
Always do flexible landings with good support on the foot.
Do not sacrifice the technique to gain speed.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the front bar.

How to make the front bar?: 1: The front bar is one of the best triceps bodybuilding exercises.Sit at the end of a flat bench with a bar of dumbbells on your thighs.
2: Enter the bar with a handling in pronation (palms down), hands being spread from the width of the shoulders.
3: Lie on your back and bring the bar to your chest.Start your arms above the latter.
4: By keeping the elbows motionless and not pointed out, slowly lower the bar until it is about 2 cm from your forehead.
5: Take a break, then slowly hold your arms to return to the starting position.
6: Do not lock your elbows, then repeat the exercise until you have reached the number of repetitions desired.

Advice for the front bar: Always heat your elbows by starting with light loads and progressively progressing with heavier loads.
You can lower the bar slightly below your head for a significant or just stretch in your forehead for a shorter amplitude of motion.
Do not block your elbows during the concentric (positive) part of the exercise.This helps maintain tension on the triceps and protect your elbow joint.
If you suffer from an elbow tendonitis, make adds.
It is very important that you keep your elbows inside during the series.The latter will tend to move away when you move the load, but you will have to keep them directed forward.
Limit the movement of your shoulders as much as possible.The movement must be done mainly by the elbows.
Instead of lengthening by holding the bar, you can lie down and ask a training partner to pass the bar.
You can use a straight bar if you don't have access to an EZ bar.Although the EZ bar is preferable, a straight bar can do the trick if necessary.
Is the position of your handles correct?Your hands must be on the inner part of the bar, as shown below.

Advice for the front bar.caption: Use the inner socket to hold the bar.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the tilted thigh press.

How to make the tilted thigh press?: 1: Sit on the thigh press and set the platform so that you can train comfortably with a complete amplitude of motion.Place your feet on the upper half of the platform so that your heels are aligned with your knees.
2: Then enter the side safety handles and push the platform of the thigh press with your feet until your legs are tense.
3: Then turn the safety handles to the outside to unlock the platform.
4: Inspire by folding the legs and lowering the platform until your knees are almost completely bent.
5: By pushing with your heels and the middle of the foot, go up the platform to the starting position while expiring.
6: Make the desired number of rehearsals, then locate the platform by putting the safety handles in place.

Training advice: Keep your feet flat on the platform, and your knees and toes pointing in the same direction (slightly outward).
Hang your legs well with each rehearsal, but without locking the knees.
Go down to the maximum to make your muscles work as much as possible on a large amplitude of motion.Do not make the mistake of making a quarter or half-repetitions.
Make sure your back is firmly backed by the folder.Your chest and legs must form an angle of 90 degrees as on the illustration of the thigh press seen in profile below.

Training advice.caption: The tilted thigh press seen in profile.

Training advice: The more you put your feet high on the platform, the more you ask the glutes and lesischio-legs.The lower your feet, the more you will focus on your quadriceps.
The more your feet are apart, the more you focus on the adductors and internal quadriceps.
The closer the feet, the more the external quadriceps will be asked.

Training advice.caption: The inclined thigh press used unilaterally.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at curl at the helm.

How to make curl at the helm?: 1: Take a bar with a supination and width of the shoulders.Stay standing up and hold the bar at the thighs.
2: Position your feet apart from the width of the hips, their knees slightly bent.Pull your shoulders backwards and take out your chest.
3: Bend the elbows to raise the load.Move your elbows lightly forward, but no more than a few centimeters.
4: Lift the bar until your forearms are perpendicular to the ground.Take a short break to contract your biceps.
5: Unfold the elbows to bring the bar down.Bring the elbows back to their initial position.
6: Lower the bar until you come back to the starting position.
7: Repeat the movement until you make the desired number of rehearsals.

Tips for curl at the bar: Using too much load is the cause of many errors.It is therefore imperative that you use a weight that you can really control.It is much more productive to make curl with a 5 kg bar too light than to make curl with a 5 kg bar too heavy.Do not let your ego convince you otherwise.

Maintain a neutral spine.The hips remain motionless, the torso is straight and the back must remain vertical.LesAbdominals have to be contracted at any time.This is a bending of biceps, which means that you are supposed to lift the bar with your biceps, and not with your whole body!

Tips for curl at the bar.caption: Comparison of the right and bad position of the back during the standing bar.

Tips for curl at the bar: Make sure your knees remain slightly bent at any time.Do not stretch them to generate a leg movement.Likewise, do not lean down to obtain a biomechanical advantage by partially placing yourself under the bar.
Use an EZ-CURL dumbbell bar to avoid forcing on the wrist, as could happen with a straight bar.The design of the EZ-CURL bar allows different ergonomic positions of the wrist.
Adjust the width of the handles to work the biceps from a different angle.A wide grip allows you to focus on the internal part of the biceps.A narrow intake target the external part of the biceps.

name: Baddha Virabhadrasana (posture of the warrior humble)

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the posture of the humble warrior.

How to make the posture of the humble wa: 1: Start Entidasana (mountain posture), feet joined and arms along the body.Distribute the weight evenly in your feet.On an expiration, place your left leg about 1.5 m behind you and turn this rear foot at a 45 -degree angle so that the toes are pointed out to the upper left of your carpet.The front toes are pointed out forward and are parallel to the front edge of the carpet.

2: The feet should be aligned at the heel.For more stability, you can move the right foot to the right of a few centimeters.Keep the hips shot forward of the carpet.On an expiration, bend the right leg at 90 degrees so that the knee is directly above Lachevilleet that the tibia is perpendicular to the ground.Divide the weight in a homogeneous manner on the front foot by lifting the plantar vault and taking support on the ends of the foot.

3: Engage the quadriceps of the rear leg.The leg must be stretched without locking the knee.Root the outer edge of the rear foot in the floor by pushing the large toe.On an inspiration, lift your arms above the head.Bring the coccyx to the floor by gently pulling the navel inward and the spine (backward retroversion).
4: On the following inspiration, place the arms behind your back, intertwine your fingers and bring your hands closer to the hands.Lean gently behind and open your chest upwards.

5: Exhale by leaning forward, bringing your chest back inside your right thigh.Pull your arms upwards.Increase stretching by bringing your head to the ground, or even putting the top of your head on the carpet if you can.
6: Stay here in this position for 10 deep breaths, then repeat on the other side.To get out of the posture, simply follow the steps in the opposite direction.

Training advice: Most beginners will find it difficult to keep the heel aligned with the hobby in the back.For the latter, they can spread their feet as much as possible, as if they were standing on the two rails of a railroad.This is also profitable for people whose hip muscles are steep.
You can hold a towel or elastic instead of reaching your palms if you have limitations at the level of the Extensions.
Beginner practitioners can place their palms on the ground to first find stability and balance, then gradually stretch their arms backwards.

As an inversion, the posture of the warrior humble places your head lower than your heart and your hips.This can affect your blood circulation, which can have harmful consequences in hypertension, eye problems such as glaucoma, heart problems or pregnancy.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the Curl Stop Ez.

How to make the Curl Stop Ez?: 1: Sit on the bench, the elbows based on the support.
2: Start your arms and grab the Ez bar with supination hands (palms up).
3: Keep your back straight, keep your chest open and shoulders back.

4: The body being held in place, bring the bar upwards, bending the biceps.Make a short break at the top of the movement and contract the biceps as loud as possible.Hold the position for a second.Slowly go down to the starting position by constantly controlling the load.
5: Repeat the movement to the number of repetitions desired.

Tips for the Curl Study Ez: If you start with this exercise, start with a light load and gradually increase.
Even light loads can give effective results if you emphasize an excellent technique, as well as a slow and controlled tempo.
Do not “rest” at the top of the movement: always contract your biceps even in a high position where the tension is less important.
Use a wide socket to request the inner part of the biceps and a tight socket to solicit the outer part.
As with all the movements in the bar, be sure not to break your wrists during the movement.Your wrists must always be aligned with your forearms as shown in the animation below.

Tips for the Curl Study Ez.caption: Comparison between the right and bad position of the curl Ez bar core.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked for the Arnold developed.

How to do the developed Arnold?: 1: Installez un banc de weight training inclinable à 90 degrés et choisissez la charge souhaitée dans le rack.
2: Prenez les dumbbells au sol en utilisant une prise neutre (paumes vers l’intérieur). Placez l’extrémité des dumbbells sur vos genoux et asseyez-vous sur le banc.
3: With a controlled movement, raise your knees one by one in order to put each dumbbell in place.
4: The starting position is a bent arm in front of you, the palms of hands at the top and supination (turned towards you).
5: Inspirez profondément, puis levez les dumbbells en tendant les coudes (sans les verrouiller) et en contractant les muscles deltoïdes. Ne cambrez pas le bas du dos.
6: While lifting the dumbbells, pivot them until your palms are turned forward.
7: Redescendez ensuite lentement les dumbbells jusqu’à la position de départ (les bras doivent être à environ 90 degrés ou légèrement plus bas).
8: Repeat the movement until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals.

Advice for the Developed Arnold: If the dumbbells are heavy, place them on your thighs at the knees.Perform a small explosive flexion of a calf to create an impulse that will help you mount the dumbbell.Make the same maneuver to mount the other dumbbell.
Hold your back -plated back against the file for the duration of the exercise.
Keeping your elbows slightly bent at the top and not to lock them completely will help you maintain a certain tension on your shoulders.
To maintain a stable position on the bench, lower the two dumbbells to the same rate.
Avoid movements from front to back or from one side to the other, they could make you lose your balance with a risk of injury.

name: Extensions concentrées des triceps à la pulley

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with concentrated extensions of triceps in the pulley.

Comment faire les extensions concentr\u0: 1: Fixez une poignée simple sur une pulley haute.
2: Then enter the handle with your left hand and kneel so that your right knee is on the ground and your left foot on the ground.Your chest must be straight.
3: Now put the back of your left arm on the inside of your thigh as if you were doing a concentrated curl.
4: Start your forearm downwards by bending your triceps until your arm is tense.Exhale during this part of the movement.
5: Then slowly flex your elbow until your forearm is parallel to the ground and make the number of rehearsals desired.Inspire during this part of the movement.
6: Repeat the exercise with the right arm by placing your left side against the machine.This time, place your left knee on the floor and place your right foot flat on the ground.
7: Alternate between each arm for the series.

Training advice: Use a lighter load and focus on obtaining good congestion by strongly contracting the triceps with each repetition.
As a rule, always start by training your lowest side.For most people, it means working the left triceps before the law.
Do not completely hold your arm during the flexion movement to keep a maximum of tension on the triceps.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with Good Morning with elastic.

How to make good morning with elastic?: 1: Take the resistance or elastic band and stand up, your feet set off with the width of the epaules.
2: Place yourself on the middle of the resistance band and hold both sides of the elastic with your hands.
3: Lean so that you can wrap the elastic band around your shoulders.Then get up.
4: Hold each side of the resistance strip in your hands and start pushing your hips back.Your knees should be slightly bent.
5: Lorsque vous ressentez un fort étirement des hamstrings et que vous ne pouvez plus repousser vos hanches vers l’arrière, ramenez vos hanches vers l’avant pour revenir à la position de départ.
6: Repeat the movement until you make the number of rehearsals desired.

Training advice: Keep the chest open and lower back in a neutral position.Your weight should be placed to your heels while keeping your feet flat.
Avoid rounding or arranging your back.A flat back will reduce stress on your spine and the bottom of your back.
When you do this exercise, bring your shoulders back to the back.Bringing together your shoulder blades will help you maintain a good back position throughout the movement.

Don't look too low!The degree of flexion that you can reach largely depends on the mobility of your posterior chain.If you are not the most flexible person, do not go too far.Try to increase your amplitude of motion gradually, going downward and lower.
Keep your contracted vosabdomine.

Choose the elastic goodband!When you do the good Morning using a resistance band for the first time, start with a low -resistant strip and gradually increase.In this way, you can learn and assimilate the right movement technique before increasing the level of resistance.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested in the front squat with double kettlebell.

How to make the front squat with Double: 1: Choose two kettlebells and place them between your legs.
2: Spread your feet with an equal or slightly higher spacing than your shoulder width.
3: Bring the kettles one after the other at your shoulders with their hands in pronation.
4: Keep the elbows high (do not leave the elbows along the body), inspire deeply and descend by backing off the hips and simultaneously folding the knees.
5: Start reversing the movement before your mobility is lacking.It is generally easier to lower lower than the rear squat, below the parallel.
6: Keep lesabdominel and push your feet in the ground to go up.
7: Return to the starting position, exhale, then repeat for the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: If the load is not too heavy and if you want to make your rehearsals with an important cadence, it is possible to make an expiration during the ascent.
You can reach your hands to keep the handles of the kettlebells together if it seems more comfortable.
The angle of the toes is very individual, experimenting with it to find what suits you best.

For an effective push, you will have to push with the entire foot.You should have three contact points: the big toe, the small toe and the heel.In addition, pushing either in heel or with the tips of the toes is likely to unbalance you.

If you do not have two kettlebells of the same weight, you can still perform the front squat with two kettlebells of different size on each side.After each series, change aside so that the heaviest kettlebell is held in the opposite hand.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with hyght apart.

How to do hyght apart?: 1: Start by adjusting an inclined bench to around 45 degrees, higher than what you would usually use to do inclined developed or apart.
2: Hold a dumbbell in each hand, the supination forearms (palms up).
3: Lightly flex the elbows and hold your arms slightly apart on the sides.
4: En gardant les coudes légèrement fléchis, expirez en ramenant les dumbbells vers le haut et vers le milieu du corps.
5: Hold this position for two seconds and contract the pectoral muscles.
6: Inspire by reversing the movement to return to the starting position.
7: Repeat this movement until you have made the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: Do not take heavy loads.Even 10 kg dumbbells will give you a hard time in this exercise demanding for the top of the pectorals.
Be sure to focus on the work of pectoral muscles, not that of shoulders or biceps.
Keep the chest open (tightened shoulder blades) throughout the movement to gain stability and protect your shoulders.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the reverse PEC deck.

How to make the inverted pec deck?: 1: Placez-vous face à l’appareil de weight training en position assise, la poitrine contre le support et les poignées placées devant vous.
2: Start the arm forward and enter each handle with a pronation or neutral socket.
3: Contract the rear deltoids while keeping the elbows slightly bent and open the arms by making a circular movement back.
4: Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position and repeat the movement to the desired number of repetitions.

Advice for the inverted pec deck: Make sure that the movement comes entirely from the moving of the forearm at the shoulder rather than the retraction of the scapula.
The shoulder blades should not move at any time, there may be a slight retraction at the end of the movement.
Do not let your head bend forward when the arms open.

Another current error is to raise your shoulders upwards.This error occurs most often when the person tries to load heavier than he can bear: he therefore tries to cheat with the trapezoids to move the load, to the detriment of the work of the posterior deltoids.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted on the front slits with Kettlebell.

How to make the front slits with Kettleb: 1: Take a pair of kettlebells by folding the hips then the knees.Keep your back straight and not bent forward.

2: Standing, the feet spaced with the width of the shoulders, inspire and contract the abdominal muscles, take out the chest and make a slot forward with your left leg.The slit must be long enough for your front leg forms a 90 degree angle while your rear or straight leg affects the floor.
3: Exhale, then push on the left leg to return to the starting position.
4: You can make the slots with Kettlebell alternately or by changing the leg at the end of the number of rehearsals in series.
5: Repeat until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: When you set off forward, do not rotate your knee inward in the slit position.
Keep your head high and back straight throughout the exercise.Never let your back round up.
Keep your body in a vertical position, but do not make an excessive extension of the lumbar column.
Keep in mind that with any type of slit, if you want to focus on Lesquadriceps, you need to take a little smaller step and get up with the tip of the foot.
If you want to emphasize the glutes and the leg lesischio-leap, take a slightly bigger step and go up with the heel of the foot.
Avoid slots if you have problems with the basin instability or an ankle.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the posture of the tiger.

How to make the tiger posture?: 1: Put yourself on your knees while advancing to place the palms on the ground.The knees must be removed from the hips and the palms are placed just under the Spales, at the distance from the width of the shoulders.
2: Make sure that the feet are aligned with the knees and placed at the toes.The heels are oriented upwards while the toes are laid firmly on the ground.
3: Keep the wrist on the ground well with all the fingers that touch the floor and make sure that the palms of the hands also touch the ground.
4: Raise the chest and bring it forward, ensuring that the shoulders remain just above the wrists and that the elbows are stretched and not bent inside.
5: Once in this position, make sure that the dudossait stocking straightened up, while also climbing the neck.

6: Inspire and raise the left knee of the ground and bring it back to the inside of your chest, balancing carefully on your right knee and your palms of hands.By expiring, stretch it backwards and raise the left thigh behind you, as high as possible while keeping the left left knee.
7: The left thigh is now parallel to the ground and the left toes point upwards.Once you have acquired insurance at this level, lift your neck and look up by opening the chest to the maximum.

8: Look for the lower left side of the abdomen and the left side of the hips.Breathe slowly and deeply, and with each inspiration, tighten the belly and at each expiration, extend the posture and raise the left leg above.

9: When you feel confident, slowly try to bring the feet backwards of your head, bending the ankles.By lifting the thighs and bringing the feet backwards, you improve the posture by creating a large opening in the hips.

10: Balance your body in this position, ensuring that the belly is returned to help keep the hips and lower back firm.Stay in this posture for about 4 or more breaths according to your level of practice.
11: Then exhale by bringing your left knee against your forehead.Hold this posture for the same duration.

12: To release, inspire and descend the left knee, release the neck and place the left knee on the ground, aligned with the right knee and the left wrist.By replacing the left knee on the ground, make sure that the alignment of the wrists and knees are perfect.Take a few breaths while entering the neck to release the tensions around the shoulders.
13: Repeat these movements on the other side.

Training advice: When you are in the posture of the tiger, monitor the movement of the spine in inspiration and expiration and stretch the muscles as much as possible.
At first, due to the stiffness of the body, it will be difficult for some practitioners to finish Asana in one go.It is necessary to respect its bodily limits here and to avoid forcing too much.
Practitioners with lower back pain, hip, neck and knee injuries in recent months will have to refrain from posting the tiger.
In case of back pain, cervical or spondylarthritis, ask a doctor for advice or practice the posture of the tiger under the supervision of a qualified teacher.
Avoid doing Vyaghrasana during pregnancy.
People with heart problems will have to perform this posture by being guided by an experienced teacher;People with abdominal will also avoid it.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the alternating Kickback seated.

How to do the alternating kickback?: 1: Choisissez les dumbbells appropriés et placez-les sur le sol devant un banc plat.
2: Asseyez-vous à l’extrémité du banc et prenez les dumbbells avec une prise neutre (paumes vers l’intérieur). Vos pieds doivent être écartés d’environ la largeur des épaules.
3: Prepare for the starting position while keeping your back straight and leaning on the size.Your chest must be closest to the parallel with respect to the ground.
4: Return your arms closer to your chest and fold the elbows, forming an angle of 90 degrees with your arms and forearms.This is the starting position.
5: Starting with the left arm and moving only at the elbow, raise the dumbbell behind you until your arm is completely tense.
6: Take a break, then go down the dumbbell in the starting position.
7: Repeat this movement with your right arm, then repeat this movement until you have made the desired rehearsals.

Training advice: Focus on the dumbbell movement, keeping control of the load both on the concentric phase, as well as the eccentric phase.
Hold your body as motionless as possible, moving only your forearms.
Keep your head aligned with your back, looking at the bottom slightly forward the exercise.
You can do this exercise with both arms simultaneously if you run out of time, but the alternating version will bring you better execution of the movement.
Start with light dumbbells, then increase the load only if you can keep a good technique.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested in unilateral rowing with landmine.

How to do the unilateral rowing at the L: 1: Place a bar in fixing the Landmine or in the corner of a wall.
2: Lean forward from an offbeat position and enter the bar with a pronation.
3: Position the bust so that the chest is practically parallel to the ground and the back is flat.
4: Start the movement by bringing the elbow behind the body while retracting the scapula.
5: Pull the bar towards your hip until your elbow is at the midline (or just after), then go down slowly and in a controlled manner to the starting position.
6: Repeat this movement until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals, then repeat it on the other side.

Training advice: Push your hips backwards, keep your knees stretched (do not lock them) and keep the abdominal belt firm.
Pull and descend in a controlled manner, do not jack and do not drop the bar.
To improve the amplitude of movements, load the bar with small discs.Small discs leave more space than large discs for greater stretching in the low position.
Due to the circumference of the bar, it may be useful to use straps for this exercise, because it can cause cuff pain in some.

Training advice.caption: Variant of unilateral Rowing with Landmine in neutral.
Variant of unilateral Rowing with Landmine supported against a bench.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with apart with suspension straps.

How to do the apart with suspension stra: 1: Attach the straps to a support located above your head (barrel bar, beam, solidly anchored hook, etc.).
2: Sear the handles and, the shoulders down (not raised), stretch your arms in front of your shoulders, palms face to face, and place your feet behind you.Lean forward.This is the starting position.
3: Lightly bend the elbows and spread the arms to the exterior to form a "T" with the body.

4: When you feel a good stretch at the pectoral level, bring your arms together to bring them to the starting position, always with the slightly bent elbows.Contract your pectorals as much as possible at the end of the movement.

Training advice: Inspire by lowering yourself slowly to the lowest point that is comfortable for your shoulders.Exhale by returning to the starting position.
The plane of the movement of the arms and the suspension straps must be perpendicular to the body.The elbows should be directed outwards throughout the movement.
The upper body and lower body must be kept straight throughout the movement: keep the itbdominel tension throughout the exercise.
Hold the handles firmly and do not go further than flexibility and the strength of your shoulders allow it.
You can make the exercise more difficult by holding a little more leaning down (in this case it will be necessary to extend the straps).
Conversely, if you start, it is possible to make this exercise easier by standing straight.
By associating them with the pompes and with the Dips, you get complementary thirds to build your upper body at home.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the posture of the mountain.

How to do Tadasana?: 1: Stand up, slightly apart and make sure your weight is also distributed over both feet.
2: Inspire and raise your arms over your head.Move your fingers, palms upwards.Look in front of you.
3: Raise your heels and put yourself on tiptoe.Feel your body stretching.Look up.
4: Place your body weight on your toes and stretch your shoulders, arms and chest upwards.
5: Hold this posture for a few moments.
6: Exhale and return to the starting position.

Training advice: Tadasana can be practiced with their eyes closed once the posture has been mastered.You can also attach your hands at the heart of the heart in a prayer position.
Variants consisting in raising your arms also exist.Urdhva hastasana with the arms stretched towards the sky or hastauttanasana with the hands behind the back and the intertwined fingers.
For beginners, Tadasana can be practiced near a wall.The touch of the heels, the pelvis, the shoulders and the head allows you to better align the body.
If the standing position is uncomfortable, practice the mountain posture on a chair, following the instructions for the upper body while keeping the feet firmly anchored on the ground.
Be sure not to round your shoulders forward.
Your legs should be stretched without locking the knees.

Training advice.caption: Tadasana is also taught with the palms of worms forward.This position is often called by abuse of language as the posture of the mountain.

Training advice: Old people ;
Children;
Pregnant women ;
People with postural problems;
People with diseases such as COPD, ankylosing spondylitis or Parkinson's disease.
People who have difficulty standing for a long time;
People who have migraines or chronic dizziness;
People who have a blocked knee problem;
People who have spine problems;
People with hypotension.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with Nordic Hamstring Curl with elastic.

How to do the Nordic Hamstring Curl with: 1: Set elastic on an anchor point in height.
2: Pass your bust at the shoulders in the elastic loop.
3: Set in front of the anchor point at around 1 meter.
4: Place your feet under the footrests and pitch them against the metal plate behind you.
5: Go down the body to the floor by tilting it from the knees.
6: Then straighten up completely by repositioning your knees bent at 90 degrees, the hips completely extended and the torso perpendicular to the ground.
7: Repeat this movement until you make the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: To progress, the tension of the elastic should be reduced by increasing its length or using a finer elastic once the number of repetitions required is reached.
If you do not have a Nordic curl device, you can also use a cushion under your knees and call on a training partner to hold your feet at the heels.
You can also make the Nordic curl with an espalier.With this configuration, hold the elastic with the hands placed behind your head as on the animation below.

Training advice.caption: Nordic Hamstring Curl with elastic on an espalier.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with Utthita Parsvakonasana.

How to do Utthita Parsvakonasana?: 1: You can start in laposture of warrior IIOU in the mountain laposure.In the posture of the mountain, raise your arms horizontally so that they are parallel to the ground.Display your feet by just over a meter.
2: Turn your left foot to the outside left at an angle of 90 degrees.Your right heel must now be aligned with the left heel.
3: Pivot your left hip inside while leaning the top of your chest to the left.

4: Flex your left knee on the Lachevillegauche so that the tibia is perpendicular to the ground.Keep the left thigh parallel to the ground.Make sure that the right heel is firmly placed on the ground and that the leg is tense.

5: Place your left forearm on the left thigh.If you want to increase stretching, place your left hand inside or outside the left foot, depending on what is most comfortable.You can place the tips of your left hand on the ground to increase the length.A brick on hand is also welcome if necessary.

6: Raise your right arm directly upwards, towards the ceiling.Keep your arm stretched and the chest stretched to avoid arched the body.Make sure your whole body is stretched.Hold this position for a few breaths and change aside.

Training advice: It is possible to make the posture of the side angle against a wall.This will help you keep your back.
Make sure your knee is placed above the ankle and not further forward (a vulnerability position).

Many practitioners tend to let the chest sink forward in Utthita Parsvakonasana, so that the chest is slightly turned down rather than upwards.The reason is often that the front hand does not quite reach the ground, either because the arm is too short compared to your legs, or because the amplitude of motion of the hip is limited to allow an inclinationlateral.The solution is to keep the forearm placed on the thigh or put your hand on a brick.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with the tilts tilted with dumbbells.

Comment faire les \u00e9cart\u00e9s incl: 1: Attrapez les dumbbells sur le sol en les tenant avec une prise neutre (paumes vers l’intérieur). Placez les dumbbells au niveau du haut des cuisses et installez-vous sur un banc incliné.

2: Pour vous mettre en position, allongez-vous et placez les dumbbells près de votre poitrine. Une fois que vous êtes en position, respirez profondément, puis amenez les dumbbells en position haute, bras tendus sans verrouiller les coudes.
3: Rétractez légèrement vos omoplates, puis abaissez lentement les dumbbells latéralement tout en maintenant l’angle au niveau du coude.
4: Lorsque les dumbbells arrivent à la hauteur de la poitrine, inversez le mouvement en contractant les pectoraux pour ramener les dumbbells en position de départ.
5: Sans laisser les dumbbells se toucher, enchaînez avec la répétition suivante et continuez jusqu’à la fin de la série.

Training advice: An inclination of 30 degrees is more than enough to overload the upper part of the pectoral.The more important the inclination, the more the previous deltoids will participate in the movement.
Do not excessively tighten the handles of the dumbbells, as this can cause excessive recruitment of forearms and biceps, thus reducing the mobilization of pectorals.
Avoid touching or hitting the dumbbells at the top of each repetition in order to maintain constant tension on the pectoral muscles.
Always keep your elbows slightly bent and never go down the dumbbells to the point of feeling any pain or pressure in the front of the shoulder joint.
Be sure to maintain a certain tension in your abs and do not let the bottom of your back arched excessively.

Do not use very heavy dumbbells for this exercise or any other apart.The risk of injury and in particular tear of the Grand Pectoral is high with maximum loads.Prefer a drive with a light to moderate load with a slow tempo to increase the time on tension.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the developed declined with dumbbell.

How to do the developed declined with du: 1: Saisissez les dumbbells sur le sol en utilisant une prise neutre (paumes vers l’intérieur). Placez les extrémités des dumbbells dans le pli de votre hanche, puis asseyez-vous sur le banc décliné.

2: Pour vous mettre en position, allongez-vous et gardez les dumbbells près de votre poitrine. Une fois en position, inspirez profondément et poussez les dumbbells jusqu’à atteindre la position haute.
3: Abaissez lentement les dumbbells en maîtrisant la trajectoire, aussi loin que possible (les poignées doivent être à peu près au niveau de votre poitrine).
4: Contractez à nouveau les pectoraux et remontez les dumbbells jusqu’à la position haute.
5: Repeat the movement to the number of repetitions planned.

Advice for the developed declined with d: Maintain a greater tension in the pectorals by not completely locking the elbows.
Do not let the dumbbells collide at the top of each rehearsal: making them come up against you could make you lose stability in the shoulders and injure yourself.
Keep your shoulder blades tight against each other to make sure that the shoulders remain in a safety position: the shoulders should not move forward to raise the load.
If you feel pain in the shoulder joint itself (more precisely at the front), make sure your shoulder blades are slightly retracted and try to keep the scapular belt in place.
Be sure to maintain a certain tension in your abs and do not let the bottom of your back arched excessively.
Keep your feet flat on the floor and do not let the lower body move during the series.

name: Developed inclined to the convergent machine

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the converging machine developed.

How to make the converging machine devel: 1: Sit on the machine's seat, the handles below shoulder height as on the illustration below.The position of the handles must correspond to the position of the bar when you make the bench press.
2: Place your palms on the handles, inspire and tighten your shoulder blades against the bench.
3: Push the handles by expiring, while keeping the shoulder blades against the bench.The shoulders should not go forward.
4: Repeat the movement to the desired number of repetitions.

Tips for the converging machine develope: Many practitioners prefer a plug -in outlet with this machine, because they believe it is easier to maintain tension in pectorals and triceps rather than having to worry about tightening the bar.
If you feel pain in the shoulder joint (especially at the front), make sure that your shoulder blades are always in contact with the bench, and try to keep your scapular belt "sheathed".
Be sure to maintain a certain tension in your abs and do not let the bottom of your back arched excessively.
Keep your feet flat on the ground and let the lower body move during the series.

image_src_note.caption: Les muscles sollicités avec les burpees : un exercice de weight training qui permet un entraînement complet du corps.

How to make burpees?: 1: Standing position to start the legs and place the hands on the ground with your feet back to put yourself on board of her stomach.
2: Cutting position a right back pumple, by contracting your pectoral muscles and by pushing energetically with the arms
3: Position of the frog with the feet on the ground by vigorously contracting the abdominals while throwing the legs forward.

4: Sautpour finish your sequence, from the position of squat “Frog Squat” (squat frog), make an explosive vertical jump with the arms stretched above the head.You have made a complete burpee and can now return to position.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the Sumo earth with Kettlebell.

How to make the Sumo earth lifted with K: 1: Put yourself in the “sumo” position;feet apart beyond the width of the shoulders.Both hands on the handle of the kettlebell which is positioned between the legs.
2: The arms are tense.The kettlebell should be in the shoulder axis.
3: The tibias are vertical.The hips are higher than the knees, but lower than the shoulders for a stable position and a flat back.

4: Push your heels into the floor and stretch your knees.When the Kettlebell is up to the knees, bring your hips forward to pass the Kettlebell over the knee level, which corresponds to the high position.Hold your legs well.
5: Fold the hips then the knees to bring the kettlebell back to the starting position.Repeat the exercise until you have done the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: The lifting of the earth consists of a flexion of the hips, not in a squat.If you place the hips that are too low, you will place yourself in a disadvantageous position on the biomechanical plane.
A common error in the sulfi of Sumo earth with Kettlebell is to start the exercise with the rounded back, which places the lower back in a vulnerability position.
Another current error is to stretch your legs during the initial push, which exposes the lower back and the hamstrings to injuries.

Training advice.caption: Sumo earth lifting can also be made with a dumbbell if you don't have Kettlebell.

image_src_note.caption: Muscles contacted in crunch.

How to do the crunch?: 1: Lie on a sports carpet, knees folded and feet on the ground.
2: Place your two hands on the back of your head without crossing your fingers.Your spine and your pool must be in a neutral position.
3: Exhale and contract your abs while taking up your upper body from the ground.
4: Once your abdominals are completely contracted and the upper back is no longer on the ground, slowly go down to the starting position.
5: Repeat the movement until you have reached the number of repetitions desired.

Crunch tips: Do not pull on your neck.This limits the work of the abs and is likely to traumatize your cervicals.

It is tempting to let the shoulders come back to the ground, but the best approach is to maintain the tension of the abs throughout the movement.So don't completely relax your shoulders on the ground.
Be sure not to drop to the ground when you come back to the starting position.Ascent and descent movements must be checked.
To perform this exercise comfortably, a floor or fitness carpet will limit the feeling of crushing the vertebrae against the ground.

If you do not feel your abdominals contract, you can make some repetitions with both hands on your stomach.This technique provides a better connection between the brain and the muscles and to help recruit as many muscle fibers as possible.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the posture of the fish.

How to do Matsyasana?: 1: Lie on ledos.Your feet should be joined and your hands relaxed along the body.
2: Place your hands under the hips, palms down.Close the elbows to each other.
3: By inspiring, raise your head and chest.
4: Keeping the high chest, lower your head backwards and touch the top of the head on the ground.

5: The head slightly touching the floor, tap the elbows firmly on the floor, placing your weight on the elbows and not on the head.Lift your chest by tightening the shoulder blades.Press the thighs and legs on the floor.
6: Keep the posture as long as you can, taking long inspirations and expirations.
7: Now strain your head, lowering the chest.Bring your hands along the side of the body.Relax.

Training advice: It is important that you do this Asana slowly and that you did not rush into the different steps.
Back flexion in Matsyasana can be difficult for beginners.You can make this posture by supporting your back on a thick blanket.Make sure your head rests comfortably on the ground.
Avoid this posture if you suffer from hypertension or hypotension.
People with migraine and insomnia should also refrain from practicing this posture.
Stretch the chest and neck;
Helps relieve tensions in the neck and shoulders;
Release the respiratory tract by promoting deep breathing;
Tones the parathyroid, pituitaries and pineal glands.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the Goblet Squat.

How to do the Goblet Squat?: 1: The feet must be removed from the width of the hips, the toes being open from 10 to 15 degrees.
2: While holding the dumbbell at the chest, the elbows pointing towards the ground, enter the pelvis so that the glutes are engaged and that the bust is well sheathed.
3: From this starting position, take a large inspiration and fold your knees and hips to allow you to sit down, keeping your feet and heels on the ground.
4: The bottom of the Goblet Squat position should be very stable and you should have the feeling of being well anchored on the ground, with flat feet and the bust vertically.
5: Be sure to keep the basin below you (do not place your buttocks too behind), and keep the abdominals and the obliques contracted.
6: From your very stable squatting position, push evenly on your two feet to get up.The chest and shoulders must go back to the same pace as the hips.

Training advice: If you find it difficult to squat with a bar, this is the best version to learn to squat in vertical.
Use the dumbbell as a counterweight if you find that you lose your balance during the squat.

A certain advancement of the knees compared to the toes is acceptable provided that the knees does not deviate excessively inward or outside.People whose femur is longer will allow their knees to go further if they want to remain straight.
Hold the load close to the body.If you hold out, the weight can exert an unnecessary constraint on your biceps, diverting attention as to the proper execution of the movement.
Fold your knees carefully.A frequent error with the squat is that the practitioner folds his knees inwards at the bottom of the flexion.So keep your knees aligned with your feet.

Divide your weight evenly on your feet.Another current error when performing the squat is to put the whole point of support on the front of the feet and toes.Be sure to distribute your support uniformly over the full foot, from the heels to the toes.

name: Parivrtta Parsvakonasana (posture of the wide angle returned)

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with Parivrtta Parsvakonasanax with hand variant in namasté.
