How to make Parivrtta Parsvakonasana?: 1: Start by standing Standing Staudasana (mountain posture), the feet joined, lengthening the spine, the rear lessee and the chest forward.
2: Inspire, raise the left leg and bring it behind you extending it as much as possible, and put the toes of the left foot on the ground behind, keeping the hips straight.
3: Exhale, adjust the distance and fold the right leg at the knee, keeping the knee aligned with the right foot.
4: Now put yourself standing in Ashta Chandana, spreading your arms up and looking in front of you, keeping you on the back toes.

5: From there, rotate the shoulders to the right side and, leaning, rest the left armpit on the outside of the right knee and thigh.While doing this, push the right thigh in the inside, spread the left arm and put your left hand on the ground, near the right foot.
6: Exhale completely after the complete torsion.Adjust the right foot, hip, left shoulder, chest and abdomen to obtain a complete twist and correct alignment.

7: Once in place, inspire and raise your right arm by extending it over your head, rotating your shoulders.Stretch the fingers with the right hand, bringing the arm as far as possible, feeling stretching on the sides of the chest, back and abdomen on the right side.
8: Exhale and look up.Keep balance while breathing slowly and deeply.

9: With each inspiration, release the body while holding the alignment, and at the expiration, push the left palm to the ground and make a twist by bringing the chest to the outside and up to support the right arm so that'It does not extend further.
10: Feel the stretching at the exterior of the thighs of the right leg, arms, shoulders, chest, musclesabdomine, neck and desmollets with the rear leg.
11: Make sure that the alignment of shoulders, feet, hips, chest and head is maintained to make the most of the torsion.
12: To release, turn your head and go down your right arm, release your left hand, inspiring, and go up slowly, ending with a complete inspiration.Exhale and come back in Tadasana.
13: Relax and rest for 2 breaths.Repeat with the other side.

Training advice: In this posture, it is important to keep your neck relaxed, but active.With each inspiration, keep the body relaxed and, at the expiration, deepen the torsion, which will help you improve the amplitude of the movements of the shoulders and to make the most of the posture thanks to the consciousness of breathing.

Checking the alignment of your body during practice (unless you have a mirror) is a bit difficult.Sometimes the dishealthy can be very minor or difficult to notice, but it is likely to cause an injury.This is why it is recommended to start practicing this posture in the presence of a yoga teacher.Once acquired, it is quite possible to continue the practice alone at home.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with the Safety Bar squat.

How to make the Safety Bar squat?: 1: Install the bar just below the shoulder level and adjust the safety stops just above the knee height.
2: Enter the handles of the Safety Bar and go below.
3: Place the bar at the base of your trapezoids and look straight ahead.
4: Pick up the bar, go back 2 or 3 steps and place your feet on the shoulders.
5: Breathe deeply and keep your elbows aligned with your chest.
6: Go down by pushing the hips back and simultaneously folding the knees.
7: Once your thighs reach the parallel with the ground, start reversing the movement.
8: Keep your abdominals contracted and push your feet into the ground.
9: Finish the movement by expiring and completely extending hips and knees.

Training advice: Engage and lock your trapezus before placing the bar.
Pull the two handfuls downwards to secure the bar.

Discard your elbows when you pull the bar down.Discarding the elbows allows you to contract the top and the middle of the back more strongly.This also helps prevent your elbows from falling against your knees at the bottom of the movement.
The angle of the feet is very individual, do tests to see what suits you best.
Use the whole foot: you must have three contact points: the big toe, the small toe and the heel.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the Dead Bug.

How to make the Dead Bug?: 1: Lie on your back.Hold your arms tense to the ceiling in front of you.Bring your knees back to your chest and fold them to a 90 degree angle.In this starting position, you should look like a dead insect.

2: In one movement, hold out your left arm above your head and reach out your right leg forward.Make this movement until your arm and leg are just above the ground.Hold this extension for a second.Make sure to expire slowly as you progress.
3: Bring your arm and leg back to the initial position and repeat with the other arm and the other leg.
4: Repeat this sequence until you make 5 to 10 repetitions, or until your abdominal muscles tremble too much to continue.

Training advice: A good technique for doing the Dead bug involves having a neutral back which is neither arched nor folded, a regular breathing which allows more powerful contractions of the abdominal muscles.

The slower you go, the more your abdominal muscles must work, so take your time!Do this exercise slowly, giving your abs the time to get involved and contract, and giving you time to make sure that your back remains neutral and that your breathing aligns with your movements.

It may be tempting to raise your head to see your abs contract during the exercise, but resist temptation.It is essential to respect a good technique.The curvature of the cervical column above the ground harms the neutrality of the column, which can have an impact on your breathing and the activation of the abs.Always keep your head and neck flat, and look up.

When you do a difficult exercise, breathing is sometimes relegated to the background.This is particularly true in the case of this exercise, because you should not only focus on the contraction of your abdominal muscles, but also on the displacement of contralateral members.However, remember that complete breathing can in itself help stimulate your abs.

To intensify the exercise, keep the same technique and the same movements with a single adjustment: instead of flexing your knees, keep your legs stretched from start to finish.Your abdominal muscles will activate more intensely to prevent your back from voiding.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with side flexions with dumbbell.

How to make the lateral flexions with du: 1: Take a dumbbell with your right hand and hold it on your right side.
2: With the feet apart from the width of the shoulders, contract your abdominal muscles and open your chest.Keep your knees slightly bent.
3: Place your left hand on the side of your head or on your hip.Fold the size to your left side.Stop when you feel a contraction of the left oblique and a stretch of the right oblique.
4: Return to the starting position and repeat the movement to make the desired number of rehearsals.
5: Change side and repeat the exercise.

Training advice: Always keep your back straight, your gaze directed forward, and only lean at the level of the torso.
Focus on the stretching and contraction of oblique muscles.
Keep the dumbbells near the body.
This exercise can also be carried out by sitting on the edge of a bench.
If you do not have dumbbells, it is possible to perform this exercise with an elastic.

Training advice.caption: Lateral flexions with elastic.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with dips for pectorals (bust tilted forward).

Comment faire des dips aux barres parall: 1: Put between the parallel bars and enter the bars on each side.Make sure that the width between the bars is not too large, as it could cause tension in the shoulders.

2: Place your back: this is essential to minimize the risk of tension in the shoulder.So make sure that the shoulder blades remain tight and lowered.It is therefore important to have your chest well open, well out.To do this, you may need to provide a slight tilt of the torso forward.

3: Tighten the bar to keep the wrists, and climb up.Be sure not to bring your body back to back when you go up, and push with your hands through your palms.Your elbows will have to stay close to the body and not direct outwards.
4: Once you have reached the full extension at the top, remember to contract the back of your triceps.
5: Keeping your elbows along the body, go down until your triceps are parallel to the ground.Once the parallel has been reached, go up and make as many repetitions as necessary.

Errors to avoid: High shoulders: Keep your shoulders, far from your ears.
Too deep descent: pay attention to the tension on your shoulders.Do not go lower if you start to feel a strong tension.The risk is simply to injure your shoulder.

Bloging of elbows: Do not block your elbows at the top of the movement.By keeping a slight bending of the elbows, this allows you not only to preserve your joints, but also to maintain the tension on the triceps.

Go too fast: even in experienced practitioners, speed is a source of significant injuries (tear, dislocation or subluxation).The shoulder being one of the most fragile joints, always keep control of your movements and trajectories.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the crunch bicycle for the abs.

How to make the crunch bicycle?: 1: Lie on the ground, knees folded at 90 degrees.
2: Place your hands behind your head.
3: Exhale by bringing one knee closer to your face while bringing the elbow opposite to this knee.
4: Once your abdominals are completely contracted, slowly go back down to the starting position and repeat the movement with the opposite side.
5: Repeat it until you have made the desired number of rehearsals or the work of training for the exercise.

Training advice: Exhale strongly as if you were blowing the candles in a cake and keeping the contraction for a second to improve Laconnexion Esprit-Muscle.
Pulling your head with your hands causes excessive tension on the neck and can cause an injury.The hands should therefore at no time participate in the realization of the movement.

Training advice.caption: If your level allows it, you can make the crunchcap -bicycle movement continuously.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested from the inclined developed at the helm.

How to do the inclined developed at the: 1: Lie on an inclined bench at an angle of 30 to 45 degrees.
2: Place your shoulder blades by hugging them and placing them against the bench.
3: Enter the bar with a width greater than that of the shoulders and make sure that the wrists are straight to support the load.
4: Lightly enter your elbows to avoid forcing on your shoulders.
5: Inspire deeply and let your training partner help you lift the bar if necessary.
6: Let the bar stabilize and make sure the upper back remains well contracted after taking off the bar.
7: Inspire again and let the bar go down slowly by relaxing the elbows.
8: Go down the bar in a straight line until you touch your chest, while entering the shoulder blades.
9: Push on your heels on the ground, then go up the bar to the top by contracting the chest muscles throughout the movement.
10: Repeat this movement until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals.

Advice for the developed tilted at the h: The technique first, the charge then: nobody cares about the weight you lift if you hurt yourself.
If you want to keep more tension in Lestricet the pectorals, stop each rehearsal just before locking at the top.
Make sure that the shoulder blades remain retracted and do not let them change positions while you do the movement.
The bar must descend controlled and touch the chest, without rebound or excessive momentum.
The gluteal muscles and the shoulder blades must remain in contact with the bench for the duration of the movement.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with Paripurna Navasana.

How to make Paripurna Navasana?: 1: Start by sitting on your carpet, knees folded and feet on the floor.Lift your heels from the floor and press your toes on the floor.Imagine that you try to pull your carpet towards you with the tip of your feet.Feel your hip flexor muscles take action.
2: At the same time as your hip flexors are activated, bring your lower abdomen to your spine (commitment from the pelvic floor)
3: Keeping your chest high and open, lift your tibias until they are parallel to the ground.

4: Tighten the inside of your legs to mobilize your adductors.Start your arms forward so that they are parallel to the ground.If you want to challenge yourself, you can reach your arms towards the ceiling.You are at that time in the posture of the half-skateau.
5: Then raise your legs so that your toes are above your head.
6: After doing 3 to 5 breaths in the posture, slowly lower your legs and rest.Repeat 3 to 5 times.

Training advice: To go further in this Asana, bring your knees closer to your chest as much as possible.
If you start with Paripurna Navasana, you can put your hands back to help you keep your balance.
To start your pelvic floor, imagine that you close the zipper of tight jeans and that you close the button.
Try to place a brick between your thighs to stimulate work from inside the thighs.
For the posture of the boat, you can use a strap around the soles of your feet to help you straighten your legs.You can also hold the posture longer with this support.
Remember that, whatever the Asana you practice, the most important thing is that you do not hold your breathing.When you feel that your breathing gets complicated, let go and lie on your back.

image_src_note.caption: How to find your power position?(Remember to activate subtitles in English)

How to make a snatch?: 1: Synchronize the “recovery” of the bar by receiving the bar with your arms stretched above the head when your feet touch the ground in a position of Overhead Squat;
2: Keep your position and push the bar to obtain a stable posture of the arms with the right torso;
3: To perform a Power Snatch, you need to catch the bar in a positionedi-squat (parallel thighs or above) then come back in a standing position;
4: To make a complete Snatch, go down to the Overhead Squat position then go back to a standing position.

How to make a snatch?.title: Taking the bar above the head

Snatch variants.caption: The movement of the Snatch muscle.
The movement of the Snncy block.
The movement of the Power Snatch.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted in shrug in the pulley.

Comment faire le shrug \u00e0 la pulley: 1: Fixez une barre ou une corde sur une pulley basse.
2: Enter the bar with the hands spread about the width of the shoulders, unless you use a rope, in which case you will naturally hold it.
3: Stand straight and keep your shoulders in a neutral position, your head facing forward.
4: Hat your shoulders up and back, then tighten them for a second to get a good contraction of the trapezius.
5: Let the load slowly return to the starting position until you feel a slight stretch in the trapezius.
6: Repeat the movement until you make the desired number of rehearsals.

Training advice: Start with a light load and try to establish a good connection between the muscle and the brain before increasing the load.You must be able to visualize the muscles in motion.
The movement must be fluid and controlled, as too rapid movement could cause a neck injury.
The voluntary contraction for at least one second at the top of the movement is very important, because it makes it possible to recruit a maximum of muscle fibers.
Do not use a push movement with the lower body to raise the load.
Your arms should be completely tense.If you start to bend them, this indicates that the biceps participate in the movement which is not the purpose of this exercise.

Training advice.caption: With the motionless arms, your hands only act as "hook" for this trapezoid insulation exercise.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with the squat with suspension straps.

How to make the squat with suspension st: 1: Install the TRX or the suspension device on an accessible door or anchor point.(Lock the door for more precautions).

2: Adjust the handles and loosen the straps and bring them to you.Make sure the anchoring point can bear the weight of your body.I advise you to take a step back so that you are about 80-100 cm from the door or anchor point.
3: Standing right in front of the TRX, enter the handles and make a knee bending at 90 degrees or up to descend in a squatting position.
4: Push on your heels to get up in the standing starting position.

Training advice: Your body weight is distributed homogeneously over the entire foot (not only on your heels or your toes);
Your knees are aligned with your feet;
The spine remains neutral;
Lessepaulessont positioned downward and back.
The straps are parallel in length;
Your arms must extend naturally;
You don't look back in the squatting position.To avoid this, contract VosabdomineAfin as your right.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked for the hyperextension reverse.

How to make the reverse hyperextension?: 1: Go on the reverse hyperextension machine and block your ankles between the supports provided for this purpose.The top of your body must be lying on the machine's tray, your hips must be placed on the edge of the tray and your legs must hang directly down.
2: Hold the handles for more stability.
3: Exhale by slowly raising the lever arm as high as possible by extending your hips and the bottom of your back.
4: Try to maintain the position contracted for a brief moment.
5: Inspire and slowly return to the starting position by bringing the lever back to its initial position.
6: Repeat the movement until you complete your series.

Training advice: Keep the movement's total mastery.Don't let your momentum get you.Otherwise you risk injuring yourself in the lower back.
If you are a beginner in the practice of this exercise, start by using only your body weight.
The movement implies only the lower body, the upper body should therefore do nothing other than remain motionless on the set while you make repetitions in a controlled manner.

name: What are the causes of Butt Wink in the squat?

image_src_note.caption: A squat with Butt Wink on the left, and a squat with a neutral spine on the right.

name: Élévations latérales unilatérales à la pulley

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the unilateral side elevations in the pulley.

Comment faire les \u00e9l\u00e9vations l: 1: Fixez une poignée sur une pulley basse.
2: Place yourself next to the machine, hold your arm across the body and catch the pulley handle.

3: The side you are going to work must be the opposite of the pulley.You can stick to the frame (in support) or simply get away from the frame and place your hand that does not work on your hip or let it hang along your body.
4: Using only the strength of your deltoid (without swinging or moving from drawing up), raise your arm to the side until it is parallel to the ground.
5: Keep a slight bending of the elbow and keep the palm of your hand down.
6: Maintain the position during a fraction of a second at the top of the movement to maximize the contraction.
7: Lower the load in a controlled manner so that your deltoids still resist the charge during the eccentric part of the movement.

8: You can adjust the position of your body and the distance that separates you from the pulleys in order to feel the greatest possible tension on the deltoid throughout the amplitude of the movement.
9: Repeat the movement to the number of repetitions desired.

Training advice: To increase the difficulty of the exercise, place your two joint feet very close to the bottom of the pulley device.With the hand that does not work, grab the amount and lean the body towards the side of the machine (if you drop, you fall).By performing your side elevation in this leaning position, you increase the tension on the full amplitude of movement, especially below.

The lateral elevation movement with the hand behind the body is another popular variant.It makes it easier to isolate the lateral deltoid and part of the posterior deltoid.You also get better pre-stretching.For this variant, you just have to place yourself in front of the cable so that it passes behind your buttocks and your legs.
It is easy to cheat on this exercise by mounting the load using the momentum and dropping it downhill, so be sure to avoid these errors by controlling the load at every moment.

This exercise is not very dangerous and is not associated with risks of injury.In the illustration of side elevations to an arm above, the arm was lifted slightly above the parallel on the ground.This must be considered a complete amplitude of motion.In fact, as long as you raise your arm parallel to the ground, your deltoids will be fully contracted.There are few advantages to go much higher, because the tension decreases as you exceed the parallel, and there is a slight risk of conflict at the shoulder if you go too high or ifYou try to lift the handle over your head.
As with many pulley exercises, the Drop Set technique is particularly effective in intensifying your training.Just remove the pin from the weight battery and get it to the next light weight.

Eccentric rehearsals, where you go down the load to idle, are also an excellent technique to use with this exercise.For extreme burn, combine repetitions with maximum contraction at the top of the movement and very slow eccentric repetitions.Your deltoids will be on fire!

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with a squat pistol.

How to do the squat pistol?: 1: Start standing with your hands in front of you to balance yourself while you lower yourself.
2: Keep your chest and head high, pull your shoulders back and down, and engage your musclesabdomine.
3: Lift a foot from the ground and point it to you.

4: Start to squat in your leg in the ground, until you are in a squat position.If your mobility allows it, go down until the buttocks are a few centimeters from the ground.At this stage, the raised leg must be stretched directly in front of the body.
5: Once in the low position, engage your glutes and push on your heel to get up.Perform all the rehearsals, then change aside.

Training advice: This exercise can be very difficult, so do not be discouraged if you are not able to perform more than a rehearsal from the start.
You can make a pistol squat with a box, fixed support or a bench to familiarize yourself with the movement.This is useful if you tend at the beginning to collapse in the low position.

Training advice.caption: This version of the partial pistol squat with a support will allow you to progress by helping you gain strength, balance and confidence.

Training advice: To obtain deep hip flexion positions coupled to a correct position of the torso, you must have sufficient dorsiflection of Lacheville.Do not skimp on joint heating and mobility exercises to perfect your technique.
Bad execution can be very harmful to your knees.If you have any doubts, have your movement checked by a professional.
If you feel that your mobility is insufficient at the ankle (you find yourself on tiptoe with the heel in the air), wear weightlifting shoes or put a plate under your heel.

If you have a bodybuilding elastic band, a resistance or Trx -type suspension strap band with a height -hooking point, you can carry out the movement assisted in a complete amplitude.This variant will help you go up from the low position, which is the most difficult point of movement.

Training advice.caption: The assisted squat pistol will help you go up if you don't have enough strength in your legs to go up.

Training advice: You can round your spine when you make pistol squats, but you should not be overhauled in your back.The more you keep a right posture, the more difficult and effective the movement.
To gain strength, you can make slow rehearsals by focusing on the eccentric part of the movement.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with the stairs machine.

How to use the stair machine?: 1: Climb to the highest step of the staircase machine.
2: Program your session by following the screen instructions.
3: Hold the side bars and climb the steps, placing one foot on one step and the other on the next one (as if you were as a staircase).
4: Once your workout is finished, get cautiously descend from the machine.

Training advice: Use the side bars to balance yourself, but don't rely on them to support your body weight.
Focus on maintaining a good straight posture, from head to heels, and avoid leaning forward.

Many people climb the stairs on tiptoe, letting their heels exceed walking.This way to disassemble the stairs to the muscles of the calf and lesischio-legs.By placing your full foot on the steps, you will have a better amplitude of motion and activate more muscles for a training that will tone your thighs and strengthen your buttocks.
Once at ease with this machine, it is possible to vary your training by taking aside steps.
To intensify your exercise, climb the steps two by two.You can also climb the steps without your hands!
Check the laces of your shoes.This is obvious, but as for most machines, you would not want to trip while you train.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with unilateral curl with suspension straps.

How to make the unilateral curl with sus: 1: As the resistance force on biceps is created by body weight, the body should be put in the inclined position.To do this, use a high anchor point for the straps.Adjust the length of the strap so that it is oblique down, from the anchoring point to the shoulders.
2: Enter the handle of the strap with a supination.The position of the arm must be oriented upwards, in the extension of the suspension strap.
3: Bend the arm to straighten yourself.The ideal is that in this high position, your body is not completely vertical, but still tilted in order to maintain tension in the biceps.
4: Perform a strong voluntary contraction and slowly go down to the low position.
5: Finish your series and then renew this exercise with the other arm.

Training advice: The sheathing of abs is essential to maintain the rectilinear body and avoid rotations.Keep your hand on the hip if you feel that your bust rotates during the movement.
Determine your starting position by bending the elbow and bringing the handle closer to your shoulder.

After a few rehearsals, and because of muscle fatigue, the start of the exercise from a full extension position can become difficult.To extend your effort and push your limits, you can make decreasing series by verticizing your body.This will reduce the force necessary to make the movement, and you can make some additional repetitions.
To intensify the exercise, it will be enough to tilt the body a little more.Be careful not to slip when the body exceeds 45 °.Do not hesitate to use a heavy object to block your feet.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested with the bear walk.

How to make the bear walk?: 1: Start on a board, putting yourself on all fours on the floor, your arms stretched and the knees slightly bent.
2: Contract your abs and keep your back straight.
3: Keeping your knees slightly bent, advance your right hand and your left foot at the same time.The knees never touch the ground.
4: Then advance your left hand and your right foot.
5: Continue to alternate movements, by advancing the hands and feet coordinated.

Training advice: Keep your body aligned: be sure to maintain a correct posture throughout the exercise.Be sure to align your shoulders, hips and knees to avoid unnecessary tensions on joints and muscles.

Engage your abdominal muscles: Bear walking is an excellent exercise to strengthen the abdominal and lumbar muscles.Make sure to contract your abs and maintain a closed abdominal strap during the exercise.
Check your breathing: Adopt regular and deep breathing during the exercise.Inspire when you do the walking movement and exhale when you stabilize your body.

Start slowly and progress gradually: if you are new in the bear walking, start with slow movements to master the technique.You can then gradually increase the speed of the exercise as you feel more comfortable.
Pay attention to your work surface: choose an adequate surface to carry out the bear.It is best to opt for non -slippery soil and provide enough space to move safely.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the developed with dumbbells.

Comment faire le d\u00e9velopp\u00e9 cou: 1: Attrapez les dumbbells au sol en utilisant une prise neutre (paumes vers l’intérieur) et asseyez-vous sur le banc.
2: Pour vous mettre en position, allongez-vous et gardez les dumbbells près de votre poitrine.
3: Une fois installé, inspirez profondément et poussez les dumbbells jusqu’à ce qu’ils arrivent en position haute.
4: Descendez lentement les dumbbells aussi bas que possible (les poignées doivent être pratiquement au niveau de votre torse).
5: Repeat the movement until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals.

Advice for the developed with dumbbells: It is not recommended to drop the dumbbells on the side, unless you are used to doing it or if you use too heavy dumbbells.
Maintain a significant tension in the pectorals by not completely locking the elbows.
Do not let the dumbbells collide at the top of each rehearsal: by making them come up against, you risk losing the stability of your shoulders and injuring yourself.
Keep your shoulder blades tight against each other so that the shoulders remain well positioned.
If you feel pain in your shoulders (more precisely at the front), make sure that your shoulder blades are slightly retracted and try to keep the "firm" scapular belt.
Try to maintain a certain tension in your abs and do not let the bottom of your back arched excessively.
Keep your feet anchored on the ground and let the lower body move during the series.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the bird sitting on a bench.

How to make the bird sitting on a bench?: 1: Prenez un banc plat et sélectionnez les dumbbells souhaités dans le rack.
2: Sit straight, then tilt forward from the hips.
3: Laissez les bras pendre directement des épaules avec une prise neutre et les dumbbells au niveau des mollets.
4: Prenez une grande inspiration et amenez les dumbbells vers le haut en mobilisant les deltoïdes arrière.
5: Tentez de marquer un temps d’arrêt pour profiter de la tension maximale sur les deltoïdes, puis redescendez lentement les dumbbells vers la position de départ en gardant le contrôle du mouvement.
6: Repeat this sequence until you have made the desired number of rehearsals.

Advice for the bird sitting on a bench: Limit movements to the scapula to focus on rear deltoids and not on scapular retractors.

When you do an exercise with dumbbells, it may be tempting to take a pair of heavy dumbbells.However, rear deltoids are not the strongest muscles of the body.If you take an overly heavy load, you will eventually make partial rehearsals.The use of too heavy loads reduces the advantages of this exercise and can even cause injuries.It is therefore advisable to use lighter dumbbells and carry out complete repetitions in order to maximize the contraction of the deltoid with each repetition.
Keep the abscessed abs and do not stop the back at the top of the movement.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted at the LEG Extension.

How to make the extension leg?: 1: Select the desired load on the weight battery and insert the pin.
2: Set the machine so that you are properly positioned.
3: Your posture must be straight, with a neutral position of the head and neck.
4: Keep your back against the back of the leg extension device, engage your body and bring your buttocks back to the seat.

5: Place the lower part of your legs in contact with the padded bar.The latter must be just above your ankles.Your knees must be facing forward and your ankles aligned with your knees.Lightly bring your toes back to your knees.All rehearsals must start in this position.
6: Start the rise movement by contracting your quadriceps and stretching your legs.
7: Raise your legs until they are tense, but without locking your knees.
8: At the end of the movement, contract your quadriceps for a second, then slowly return to the starting position.

9: Fold your knees until your ankles are under your knees.If your seat is properly set and you are in an optimal position, the weights should not touch the weight battery during the downhill movement.

Training advice: If you have pre -existing problems in the knees, consult a physiotherapist or a sports coach before making leg extensions to minimize the risk of injury.A good exercise technique is essential to guarantee the safety and efficiency of a training program.

Always choose a weight that allows you to have total control of your body throughout the movement.When you do an exercise, be very attentive to your technique and stop immediately if you feel pain or discomfort.

Make sure that the knee movement axis is perfectly adequate that of the machine.If the knee is positioned too much front or behind the machine, the joint will undergo excessive stress that could cause significant injuries.

Training advice.caption: The leg extension carried out with an internal rotation of the feet.

Training advice: As you can see on the above illustration, it is possible to carry out this exercise with a rotation of the feet to accentuate the work of the internal or external part of the quadriceps.With an internal rotation, the exterior of the quadriceps will be slightly more stressed.Conversely, with an external feet rotation, it is the interior of the quadriceps will work more.Almost guaranteed burning sensation!

Training advice.caption: The leg extension carried out unilaterally.

Training advice: Correction of muscle imbalances: it is not uncommon to have one side of the body stronger or more developed than the other.By working unilaterally, you can focus on each leg separately and help correct these imbalances.
Muscle insulation: by working one leg at a time, you can better isolate the quadriceps, the target muscle of this exercise, and thus concentrate all your attention and effort on this leg.

Movement control: unilateral work allows better control of the movement.This can be particularly useful if you have difficulty maintaining good technique during the bilateral execution of the exercise.

What are the current errors?.title: Lift too heavy loads
What are the current errors?.description: This is not the machine to use to try to lift a maximum (1RM), that is to say the highest weight that you can lift in a single repetition.Due to a risk of knee ligaments, do not use this exercise for strength training, with few repetitions and high load.

What are the current errors?.title: Do too much rehearsals
What are the current errors?.description: Do not make more than three series of eight to twelve repetitions with a moderate load.You don't need to make endurance series with a large number of rehearsals on a leg extension machine.

What are the current errors?.title: Go too fast
What are the current errors?.description: If you perform this exercise at full speed, you will use the momentum rather than muscle engagement.

What are the current errors?.title: Knee lock
What are the current errors?.description: Do not lock your knees in full extension.You may damage the knee joint.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with Chaturanga Dandasana.

How to make Chaturanga Dandasana?: 1: Start by making a high board with shoulders, elbows and hands in a straight line.
2: Contract your abs, by engaging your abdominal belt, and push your thighs upwards and your heels backwards.
3: On an expiration, go on your toes and lower your body until your arms form an angle of 90 degrees at the elbow.
4: Take a break and keep the position for a few moments, keeping the whole body engaged.
5: Exhale and return to the position of the high board.

Training advice: By moving upwards with your legs, also tighten the inside of your thighs (adductor work).
Be sure not to go beyond the line of the shoulders.Your elbows should never be higher than your shoulders.At best, they will be perfectly aligned, creating an angle of 90 degrees inside the elbows.
On an inspiration, you can press your hands and tip your foot to the ground, to go to the posture of the dog downstairs.

If you start with this Asana and it is difficult to maintain, especially with the inside elbows, you can make it with the knees placed on the ground to relieve you.Your knees will be located behind your hips, so your body remains tilted.Then descend entirely on the belly and make the cobraplut laposure that the posture of the dog head down.
Be careful if you have shoulder injuries, because this posture can put pressure on the shoulders if it is not done correctly.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested at Rowing T-Bar.

How to do the Rowing T-Bar?: 1: If you use a classic bar as the only material, you will have to ensure that one of its ends is blocked by placing it in the corner of a wall.The ideal is to use an attachment provided for this purpose (Landmine).It will then be necessary to load the other end with the quantity of desired weight.
2: Race the bar by adopting a foot width equal to or greater than that of the shoulders.
3: Lean until you can grab yourself firmly with the handles.
4: While keeping your back neutral, lower the shoulder blades to the large backbone muscles.
5: By firmly holding the handle, contract your fessiers and vosischio-legs all, keeping your chest and your neck in a neutral position.

6: Then slightly lift the torso while keeping the arms stretched, so as to lift the bar a few centimeters from the ground.This allows you to have enough space to move the load in all the amplitude of the movement without sticking the ground.
7: Depending on your interest, you can tilt your chest from 15 to 45 degrees above the parallel, but no more.
8: By trying to keep the positioning described above, strongly retract the shoulder blades to initiate the draw movement.
9: Bring the elbows to the sides and climb the bar until the discs touched your chest.
10: While you get the charge, focus on the contraction of the middle of the back muscles by sliding your shoulder blades back, until you get closer to the end of the amplitude of the movement.

11: Unrestraining the tension of the torso and the abdomen, bring the bar back to the starting position with constant speed and control.Imagine that you guide the bar with precision up to the starting point.Do not just let the bar fall.
12: Once the bar is in a low position, start the movement again until you execute the desired number of repetitions.

Tips for Rowing T-Bar: To increase the amplitude of motion, use small discs, rather than the Olympic discs with a significant diameter.
Be particularly attentive to the position of your shoulder blades.They must be actively retracted and lowered so as not to allow too much movement of the shoulder forward during the eccentric phase.

During a heavy rowing, a slight movement of the torso from the hip joint is acceptable as long as there is no loss of postural rigidity and the lumbar column is not in flexion.On the other hand, if there is more than a slight movement of rise or a change in positioning, it will be necessary to reduce the load.
As with any other exercise carried out in this position, a permanent effort must be provided to prevent the back from being rounded.

The trajectory of your elbows is essential to activate the large dorsal muscles as much as possible.Try to bend the elbows on the sides while keeping the hands and wrists perpendicular to the upper part of the arm.

Due to the different levers and differentMorphologies, the ideal angle varies according to people.If you feel like you are using your arms too much, lean a little further.If you feel a tension mainly in the lower back, go up a little more shoulders.

name: Curl in hammer intake with elastic

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with curl with elastic.

How to make the curl with elastic?: 1: Place yourself in the center of an elastic band.Space your feet with a slightly narrower gap than the shoulder width.Enter one end of the band in each hand.
2: Hold the band with the palms of the hands face to face (parallels).
3: Inspire and take great breathing.Contract your arms, your abdominal strap, yourfessiers and your handle.
4: Make a flexion of the forearms on the arms, bringing your hands back to your shoulders.Hold the same position of your hands.
5: Strongly contract the biceps for two seconds at the top of the movement.
6: Exhale and go down your hands on the sides.Make the number of rehearsals planned.

Tips for curl with elastic: Keep your elbows fixed and in the same position on the sides for the duration of the movement.
Do not let the band relax at any time in the movement.A constant tension maximizes time under tension of your muscles and therefore muscle growth (hypertrophy).

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the unilateral discarded movement in the pulley.

Comment faire l\u2019exercice des \u00e9: 1: Réglez la hauteur de la pulley de haut en bas. La hauteur classique est au niveau de l’épaule, mais vous pouvez la placer plus haut pour accentuer le travail du bas des pectoraux, ou plus bas pour cibler le haut des pectoraux.

2: Hold the handle in your hand, palms turned inwards (neutral socket).Standing in an offbeat position compared to the pulley apparatus, stretch your arm without locking your elbow.This is the starting position.

3: Amenez lentement la poignée de la pulley vers le milieu de votre corps, puis inversez le mouvement en contrôlant la phase excentrique. Faites toutes vos répétitions d’un côté, puis changez de côté.

Training advice: Position yourself so that lemuscle pectoralTravailled is engaged from the start of the movement.Take a small step on the side if the cable is not in tension in the starting position.
Keep your abdominal strap engaged throughout the exercise to withstand the detractionotative force and amplify the beneficial effects of the exercise on the abdominals.
Do not hesitate to go beyond the middle of your chest during the concentric phase to work your pectorals on a maximum amplitude.
The pulley offering the possibility of quickly switching from one charge to another, take the opportunity to make degressive degrees.
To make the most of the exercise, I recommend that you put your free hand on the working pectoral muscle.This will allow you to get a much larger spirit/muscle connection.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles requested at the Zercher Squat.

How to do the Zercher Squat?: 1: Place a bar up to the navel on a squat rack, and stand up just behind.
2: Croupe yourself and position the bar under the arms so that it rests directly above the elbows, between the forearm and lebiceps.The palms of the hands should be lifted to the ceiling.
3: Once in a position, straighten yourself in a standing position.Take your breath and make sure your abdominal belt is well contracted.
4: Keeping the bar near the body, slowly fold your knees to put yourself in the squat position.
5: Go down as low as possible, take a break, then go back up to finish the rehearsal.
6: Once all the rehearsals are finished, go down and rest the bar on the rack to finish the series.

Training advice: Start with a light charge to familiarize yourself with this exercise.
As with all variants of squats, it is important to keep your knees in the axis of the feet: be sure not to enter your knees inward or outside throughout the movement.
You cannot lift a bar as heavy with this variant as with classic squats, because you will be somewhat limited by the strength of your body.
Wearing a top with long sleeves can help you better endure the bar in the hollow of the elbows.

It is difficult to breathe during the execution of the Zercher Squat because the bar presses the chest and the abdomen.This is not a problem if you make a small number of rehearsals, but if you make a large number of rehearsals, it will be difficult for you to catch your breath throughout the series.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles contacted with vertical draw inverted.

How to make the vertical draw inverted?: 1: Attach a straight bar to the drawing device and sit down.
2: Enter the bar with a supination socket and the width of your shoulders.
3: Bring your elbows down and back and tighten the shoulder blades.
4: To the strength of the back and biceps muscles, slowly go down the bar until it touches your chest.
5: Take a break and contract the muscles as firmly as possible.
6: Bring the bar back to the starting position and exhale.
7: Repeat this movement until you have reached the desired number of rehearsals.

Tips for vertical drawing inverted: Keep a certain tone of your abs when you pull the bar down to make sure that your spine is not too arched.
Do not let the momentum dominate the movement, control the load for the duration of each repetition.
Be sure to work on the full amplitude of movement for each rehearsal in order to optimize your muscle earnings.
Let the shoulders perform an internal rotation and slightly raise the shoulders at the top of the movement.
At the bottom of the movement, when you take a break, imagine that you try to grab a golf ball between your shoulder blades.

name: Trikonasana (posture of the triangle in extension)

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked with Trikonasana.

How to make Trikonasana?: 1: Hold on Standed Start (legs and arms along the body, feet joined).
2: Discard your feet at a comfortable distance.
3: Raise your arms so that they are parallel to the ground.
4: Turn your 90 degree left foot to the outside and your right foot of 15 degrees inwards.
7: Place your left hand on Lacheville.
8: Start the other arm upwards and stay in this position.
9: Gradually increase the duration of the exercise and feel stretching in different parts of your body.
10: By inspiring, go up, bring your arms along the body and straighten your feet.Repeat the same movement on the other side.

Training advice: Make sure you have a good warm-up of the whole body before making Asana.
When you lean forward, do it slowly and gently so as not to lose your balance.
Keep your head in a neutral position or turn it to the left, eyes gently fixing the palm of the left hand.
Check that your body is folded laterally and not back or forward.The pelvis and chest remain well open.
Stretch as much as possible and stay stable.Continue to take long and deep breaths.With each expiration, relax the body increasingly.

Avoid doing this posture if you suffer from migraine, diarrhea, hypotension or hypertension, or neck injuries.People with hypertension can make this pose, but without raising their hands over their heads, as it could increase blood tension more.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the Sissy Squat with machine.

How to do the Sissy Squat with machine?: 1: Debout, placez vos pieds sous le support inférieur rembourré du banc à sissy squat. Vos calves devront être en appui sur les supports du dessus.
2: Place your hands in front of your chest.
3: Keeping the high chest, inspire by bending the hips and legs to lower your body until the back of your thighs reaches the upper cushions.
4: Exhale by getting up to return to the starting position.
5: Repeat the exercise until you have carried out the required number of rehearsals.

Training advice: The right machine setting is crucial.Adjust the upper cushion in a way that it is neither too high nor too low.If the upper cushion is too high, it will limit your motion amplitude.If it is too low, the support will not be optimal.

You can hold a dumbbell against your chest with both hands to intensify the exercise.Do you want to have fun more?Once you have reached the low position, lengthen your upper body as far as possible.If you are really strong, you can look so much back that your upper body will be perfectly parallel to the ground!This allows you to stretch and engage your quadriceps, while strengthening your abs as you could not imagine.
Avoid locking the legs at the start of the movement.You should always maintain tension on the quadriceps to fully benefit from the advantages of the movement.
When you stand, don't let your chest bow forward.Your shoulders should be behind your hips.
Make sure to control the descent as you get dumbfounded.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles used with the jump rope.

How to make the jump rope?: 1: The first step is how to keep the jump rope.The position in which you hold the jump rope is crucial.Make sure the rope is held symmetrically.
2: Then there is the movement.Make a minimum movement of the elbows and shoulders.The movement of the rope should be generated from the wrists.
3: The rope jump mainly depends on the rhythm of the jumps.Your jump should not exceed the ground more than 2 to 5 cm.
4: Bring your feet back and fold your knees accordingly.Place the toes in a position such that they point slightly outwards at each jump.

image_src_note.caption: The muscles asked for squat pine.

How to do the squat pine?: 1: Place the safety bar rest inside the squat rack so that the bar touches the bar rests when you reach the parallel in your squat.
2: Pick up the rack bar as for a classic squat, go down slowly until you touch the bar rests, take a short break, then go up to the high position.
3: Perform as much rehearsals as expected.

Training advice: It is important to touch the bar rests very slightly, as a ninja would do!So don't let the bar rest completely.
If the bar is completely placed on bar rest, it is possible to release the tension at the abdominal strap.If this happens, your back can start to round, which can cause a spine injury.

Use a lighter load than with your classic squat, as you will have less strength.This is due to the fact that it is more difficult to move a heavy load from a dead point, because you cannot count on the accumulation of elastic energy that can be returned on the concentric phase.

Rickshaw Carry Instructions: 1: Position the frame at the starting point, and load with the appropriate weight. Standing in the center of the frame, begin by gripping the handles and driving through your heels to lift the frame. Ensure your chest and head are up and your back is straight.

2: Immediately begin walking briskly with quick, controlled steps. Keep your chest up and head forward, and make sure you continue breathing. Bring the frame to the ground after you have reached the end point.

name: Single-Leg Press

Single-Leg Press Instructions: 1: Load the sled to an appropriate weight. Seat yourself on the machine, planting one foot on the platform in line with your hip. Your free foot can be placed on the ground. Maintain good spinal position with your head and chest up.
2: Supporting the weight, fully extend the knee and unlock the sled. This will be your starting position.
3: Lower the weight by flexing the hip and knee, continuing as far as flexibility allows. Do not allow your lumbar to take the load by moving your pelvis.
4: At the bottom of the motion pause briefly and then return to the starting position by extending the hip and knee.
5: Complete all repetitions for one leg before switching to the other.

Benefits: Builds stronger, more muscular quads
Using one leg at time allows for heightened focus
Also recruits helps from the hamstrings and glutes

name: Landmine twist

Landmine twist Instructions: 1: Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an appropriate weight.
2: Raise the bar from the floor, taking it to shoulder height with both hands with your arms extended in front of you. Adopt a wide stance. This will be your starting position.
3: Perform the movement by rotating the trunk and hips as you swing the weight all the way down to one side. Keep your arms extended throughout the exercise.
4: Reverse the motion to swing the weight all the way to the opposite side.
5: Continue alternating the movement until the set is complete.

Benefits: Maximizes force transfer through the legs, core, and arms
Powerful rotational core training
Trains coordination and power simultaneously

name: Weighted pull-up

Weighted pull-up Instructions: 1: Attach a weight to a dip belt and secure it around your waist. Grab the pull-up bar with the palms of your hands facing forward. For a medium grip, your hands should be spaced at shoulder width. Both arms should be extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip.
2: You'll want to bring your torso back about 30 degrees while creating a curvature in your lower back and sticking your chest out. This will be your starting position.
3: Now, exhale and pull your torso up until your head is above your hands. Concentrate on squeezing your shoulder blades back and down as you reach the top contracted position.
4: After a brief moment at the top contracted position, inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position with your arms extended and your lats fully stretched.

Benefits: Strengthens the muscles of the lats (latissimus dorsi), biceps, upper back, core, and grip
Allows you to train pull-ups in lower strength-focused rep ranges (e.g., sets of 3-5 reps) if you can do many bodyweight reps
Can help boost your overall pull-up numbers
Heavy, low-rep sets activate different types of muscle fibers, potentially leading to muscle and strength gains

T-Bar Row with Handle Instructions: 1: Position a bar into a landmine or in a corner to keep it from moving. Load an appropriate weight onto your end.
2: Stand over the bar, and position a Double D row handle around the bar next to the collar. Using your hips and legs, rise to a standing position.
3: Assume a wide stance with your hips back and your chest up. Your arms should be extended. This will be your starting position.
4: Pull the weight to your upper abdomen by retracting the shoulder blades and flexing the elbows. Do not jerk the weight or cheat during the movement.
5: After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Palms-down wrist curl over bench

image_src_note.title: Palms-down wrist curl over bench Images

Palms-down wrist curl over bench Instruc: 1: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.
2: Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
3: Use your arms to grab the barbell with a pronated grip (palms down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
4: Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
5: Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
6: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
7: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Benefits: Builds size and strength in the forearms
Builds strength and flexibility in the wrists
Develops grip strength that carries over to strength in other movements
Training wrist extension can help combat training-induced elbow pain
Effective even with light weight

Atlas Stones Instructions: 1: Begin with the atlas stone between your feet. Bend at the hips to wrap your arms vertically around the Atlas Stone, attempting to get your fingers underneath the stone. Many stones will have a small flat portion on the bottom, which will make the stone easier to hold.
2: Pulling the stone into your torso, drive through the back half of your feet to pull the stone from the ground.
3: As the stone passes the knees, lap it by sitting backward, pulling the stone on top of your thighs.

4: Sit low, getting the stone high onto your chest as you change your grip to reach over the stone. Stand, driving through with your hips. Close distance to the loading platform, and lean back, extending the hips to get the stone as high as possible.

name: Dumbbell front raise to lateral raise

image_src_note.title: Dumbbell front raise to lateral raise Images

Dumbbell front raise to lateral raise In: 1: In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbbells at your side. This will be your starting position.
2: Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
3: At the top of the exercise move the weights out in front of you, keeping your arms extended.
4: Lower the weights with a controlled motion.
5: On the next repetition, raise the weights in front of you to shoulder height before moving the weights laterally to your sides.
6: Lower the weights to the starting position.

Benefits: Builds size in shoulders
Prolonged muscle time under tension
Great burnout on shoulder day or time-efficient shoulder pump in any workout

Clean from Blocks Instructions: 1: With a barbell on boxes or stands of the desired height, take an overhand or hook grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

2: Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight with the elbows pointed out.
Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight. At the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.3.  As full extension is achieved, transition into the receiving position by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. Aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
3: Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position. Return the weight to the boxes for the next rep.

Incline Hammer Curls Instructions: 1: Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. You should pressed firmly against he back with your feet together. Allow the dumbbells to hang straight down at your side, holding them with a neutral grip. This will be your starting position.
2: Initiate the movement by flexing at the elbow, attempting to keep the upper arm stationary.
3: Continue to the top of the movement and pause, then slowly return to the start position.

name: Straight-bar wrist roll-up

Straight-bar wrist roll-up Instructions: 1: Hold a barbell with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width. This will be your starting position.
2: Alternating between each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the wrist as though you were rolling up a newspaper. Continue alternating back and forth until failure.
3: Reverse the motion by flexing the wrist, rolling the opposite direction. Continue the alternating motion until failure.

Benefits: Builds hand and wrist strength
Builds forearm size and strength
Doesn't require unique equipment
If grip strength is a limitation, lifting straps allow heavier loading

name: Barbell glute bridge

Barbell glute bridge Instructions: 1: Begin seated on the ground with a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Roll the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lay down flat on the floor.
2: Begin the movement by driving through with your heels, extending your hips vertically through the bar. Your weight should be supported by your upper back and the heels of your feet.
3: Extend as far as possible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

Benefits: Strengthens the glutes, hamstrings, and quads
Allows you to track and periodize weights more easily than when using a band
Builds strength that carries over into squats, deadlifts, and other movements
Great warm-up or glute activation drill to do anytime

name: Clean and press

Clean and press Instructions: 1: Assume a shoulder-width stance, with knees inside the arms. Now while keeping the back flat, bend at the knees and hips so that you can grab the bar with the arms fully extended and a pronated grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width. Point the elbows out to sides. The bar should be close to the shins. Position the shoulders over or slightly ahead of the bar. Establish a flat back posture. This will be your starting position.

2: Begin to pull the bar by extending the knees. Move your hips forward and raise the shoulders at the same rate while keeping the angle of the back constant; continue to lift the bar straight up while keeping it close to your body.

3: As the bar passes the knee, extend at the ankles, knees, and hips forcefully, similar to a jumping motion. As you do so, continue to guide the bar with your hands, shrugging your shoulders and using the momentum from your movement to pull the bar as high as possible. The bar should travel close to your body, and you should keep your elbows out.

4: At maximum elevation, your feet should clear the floor and you should start to pull yourself under the bar. The mechanics of this could change slightly, depending on the weight used. You should descend into a squatting position as you pull yourself under the bar.

5: As the bar hits terminal height, rotate your elbows around and under the bar. Rack the bar across the front of the shoulders while keeping the torso erect and flexing the hips and knees to absorb the weight of the bar.
6: Stand to full height, holding the bar in the clean position.
7: Without moving your feet, press the bar overhead as you exhale. Lower the bar under control .

Benefits: Trains speed and power for athletic performance
Cleaning between each rep of multiple presses is a strength and conditioning challenge like no other
Great move for full-body strength and power

name: Triceps dip

Triceps dip Instructions: 1: To get into the starting position, hold your body at arm's length with your arms nearly locked above the bars.

2: Now, inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Your torso should remain upright and your elbows should stay close to your body. This helps to better focus on tricep involvement. Lower yourself until there is a 90 degree angle formed between the upper arm and forearm.
3: Then, exhale and push your torso back up using your triceps to bring your body back to the starting position.
4: Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Benefits: Builds muscle and strength in the triceps, as well as the chest and shoulders
Can add extra weight with a dip belt, dumbbell, or chain
Serious upper-body training with minimal equipment

name: Dumbbell farmer's walk

Dumbbell farmer's walk Instructions: 1: There are various implements that can be used for the farmers walk. These can also be performed with heavy dumbbells or short bars if these implements aren't available. Begin by standing between the implements.
2: After gripping the handles, lift them up by driving through your heels, keeping your back straight and your head up.
3: Walk taking short, quick steps, and don't forget to breathe. Move for a given distance, typically 50-100 feet, as fast as possible.

Benefits: Strengthens and challenges the grip, core, traps, upper back, shoulders, and legs
Serious cardiovascular challenge and calorie burn
Less complex to learn and perform properly than many other popular strength movements
Builds muscular coordination and mental toughness in addition to strength and muscle
If grip strength is a limiting factor, lifting straps can still enable you to use heavy weights

name: Palms-up wrist curl over bench

image_src_note.title: Palms-up wrist curl over bench Images

Palms-up wrist curl over bench Instructi: 1: Start out by placing a barbell on one side of a flat bench.
2: Kneel down on both of your knees so that your body is facing the flat bench.
3: Use your arms to grab the barbell with a supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
4: Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
5: Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
6: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement needed to perform this exercise.
7: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Benefits: Builds size and strength in the forearms
Builds strength and flexibility in the wrists
Develops grip strength that carries over to strength in other movements
Trains wrist flexion
Effective even with light weight

name: Barbell Full Squat

Barbell Full Squat Instructions: 1: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack just above shoulder level. Once the correct height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) across it.
2: Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it off the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

3: Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder-width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Keep your head up at all times and maintain a straight back. This will be your starting position.

4: Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knees and sitting back with your hips as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until your hamstrings are on your calves. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
5: Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the floor with the heel or middle of your foot as you straighten the legs and extend the hips to go back to the starting position.
6: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Benefits: Adds size and strength to the quads, glutes, and hamstrings
Requires back and core strength to maintain torso positioning
Can be used to improve conditioning and cardiovascular health
Considered by many to be "the king of exercises"

name: Barbell deficit deadlift

Barbell deficit deadlift Instructions: 1: Begin by having a platform or weight plates that you can stand on, usually 1-3 inches in height. Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. You feet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets.

2: With your feet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knees until your shins contact the bar. Look forward with your head, keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward. After the bar passes the knees, aggressively pull the bar back, pulling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
3: Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.

Benefits: The deficit offers a greater range of motion for targeting the hamstrings
Builds size and strength in the glutes, hamstrings, and lower and upper back
Builds overall deadlift strength

name: Barbell Deadlift

Barbell Deadlift Instructions: 1: Approach the bar so that it is centered over your feet. Your feet should be about hip-width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder-width allowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typically, you would use an alternating grip.

2: With your feet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knees until your shins contact the bar. Look forward with your head. Keep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the heels to move the weight upward.
3: After the bar passes the knees aggressively pull the bar back, pulling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
4: Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the floor.

Benefits: Primarily targets the back, hamstrings, and glutes, but also brings in the lats, traps, and forearms
Builds core strength and stability
Can be beneficial even at light or moderate weights
Simple to scale for non-powerlifters by raising the bar to where someone can perform it without flexing their lower back
If grip is a limitation, it can be performed with a mixed grip or using straps

name: Single-arm palm-in dumbbell shoulder press

image_src_note.title: Single-arm palm-in dumbbell shoulder press Images

Single-arm palm-in dumbbell shoulder pre: 1: Start by having a dumbbell in one hand with your arm fully extended to the side using a neutral grip. Use your other arm to hold on to an incline bench to keep your balance.

2: Your feet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbbell up until you create a 90 degree angle with your arm.Note:Your forearm should be perpendicular to the floor. Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
3: Slowly lift the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended. This the starting position.
4: While inhaling lower the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degree angle again.

5: Feel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight back up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the incline bench and keep your feet positioned to keep balance during the exercise.
6: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.
7: Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

Benefits: Allows for greater focus on one shoulder at a time
Forces the core to stabilize an uneven load
A neutral grip may be easier on the shoulder joint than a palms-forward grip

name: Romanian Deadlift With Dumbbells

Romanian Deadlift With Dumbbells Instruc: 1: Begin in a standing position with a dumbbell in each hand. Ensure that your back is straight and stays that way for the duration of the exercise. Allow your arms to hang perpendicular to the floor, with the wrists pronated and the elbows pointed to your sides. This will be your starting position.

2: Initiate the movement by flexing your hips, slowly pushing your butt as far back as you can. This should entail a horizontal movement of the hips, rather than a downward movement. The knees should only partially bend, and your weight should remain on your heels.
3: Drive your butt back as far as you can, which should generate tension in your hamstrings as your hands approach knee level. Maintain an arch in your back throughout the exercise.
4: When your hips cannot perform any further backward movement, pause, and then slowly return to the starting position by extending the hips.

Benefits: Strengthening the glutes and hamstrings will carry over to other forms of the deadlift such as conventional
Higher reps with lower weight will lend to hypertrophy of the hamstrings and posterior chain
Also works the calves, quads, and forearms indirectly

name: Tire flip

Tire flip Instructions: 1: Begin by gripping the bottom of the tire on the tread, and position your feet back a bit. Your chest should be driving into the tire.
2: To lift the tire, extend through the hips, knees, and ankles, driving into the tire and up.

3: As the tire reaches a 45 degree angle, step forward and drive a knee into the tire. As you do so adjust your grip to the upper portion of the tire and push it forward as hard as possible to complete the turn. Repeat as necessary.

Benefits: Builds strength and coordination from head to toe
Teaches how to project power and strength forward in sports
Builds strength endurance as well as mental toughness

Clean Deadlift Instructions: 1: Begin standing with a barbell close to your shins. Your feet should be directly under your hips with your feet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hook grip, about shoulder width apart. Squat down to the bar. Your spine should be in full extension, with a back angle that places your shoulders in front of the bar and your back as vertical as possible.

2: Begin by driving through the floor through the front of your heels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant back angle. Flare your knees out to the side to help keep them out of the bar's path.
3: After the bar crosses the knees, complete the lift by driving the hips into the bar until your hips and knees are extended.

name: Elbow plank

Elbow plank Instructions: 1: Get into a prone position on the floor, supporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.
2: Keep your body straight at all times, and hold this position as long as possible. To increase difficulty, an arm or leg can be raised.

Benefits: Forces the core to stabilize in space when performed correctly
Requires no equipment
Excellent diagnostic tool for trainers to show compensation or core weakness
To progress, lift an arm or leg, or place a weight plate on the upper back

name: Bottoms Up

Bottoms Up Instructions: 1: Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This will be your starting position.

2: To perform the movement, tuck the knees toward your chest by flexing the hips and knees. Following this, extend your legs directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to raise your glutes from the floor.
3: After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

Benefits: Intense burn and contraction of the core muscles
Great for a high-rep ab burnout
Pairs well with other ab movements in circuits

name: Barbell back squat to box

image_src_note.title: Barbell back squat to box Images

Barbell back squat to box Instructions: 1: The box squat allows you to squat to desired depth and develop explosive strength in the squat movement. Begin in a power rack with a box at the appropriate height behind you. Typically, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a parallel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

2: Begin by stepping under the bar and placing it across the back of the shoulders. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, attempting to bend the bar across your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your feet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, adductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Keep your head facing forward.

3: With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knees and butt out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Ideally, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce off of a box.
4: Keeping the weight on your heels and pushing your feet and knees out, drive upward off of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightness head to toe.

Benefits: Allows for a customizable squat depth
Encourages squatting rearward rather than downward, targeting the glutes
Works well with accommodating resistance like bands and chains
Effective substitute for back squats in any program

name: Clean and jerk

Clean and jerk Instructions: 1: With a barbell on the floor close to the shins, take an overhand or hook grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the heels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This will be your starting position.

2: Begin the first pull by driving through the heels, extending your knees. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knees.

3: Next comes the second pull, the main source of acceleration for the clean. As the bar approaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, accelerate by extending the hips, knees, and ankles, using speed to move the bar upward. There should be no need to actively pull through the arms to accelerate the weight; at the end of the second pull, the body should be fully extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms still extended.

4: As full extension is achieved, transition into the third pull by aggressively shrugging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, aggressively pull yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pull. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the bottom squat position, which will help in the recovery.
5: Immediately recover by driving through the heels, keeping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

6: The second phase is the jerk, which raises the weight overhead. Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your feet directly under your hips, flex the knees without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfully as possible.
7: Drive through the heels create as much speed and force as possible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

8: At this moment as the feet leave the floor, the feet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as possible. In the brief moment the feet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes effort to push the bar up will drive them down. The feet should be split, with one foot forward, and one foot back. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead. Return to a standing position.

Benefits: Trains speed and power for athletic performance
Allows you to use more weight than a strict press or push-press
Great move for full-body strength and power

name: Single-arm kettlebell push-press

Single-arm kettlebell push-press Instruc: 1: Hold a kettlebell by the handle. Clean the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebell towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This will be your starting position.
2: Dip your body by bending the knees, keeping your torso upright.

3: Immediately reverse direction, driving through the heels, in essence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, press the kettlebell overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight. Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.

Benefits: Momentum from the legs powers the weight through the toughest part of the press
Allows you to press more weight than a strict military press
Full-body training that challenges the lower body as well as the shoulders, arms, back, and core
Cleaning the kettlebells to the rack position trains the hips, core, and back muscles

name: Push-press
Benefits: Builds full-body power, strength, and coordination
