Positioning on incline bench makes for better isolation and takes away potential of using momentum
Works the upper and lower back as well as core to keep shoulders from rolling forward

name: Seated EZ-bar shrug
Benefits: Sitting down enforces strict form
The EZ-bar gives more clearance under the thighs during each shrug
Builds a bigger, stronger trapezius muscle
Can add pauses or manipulate tempo to make more difficult

name: Dumbbell crunch
Benefits: Allows you to train in lower rep ranges when bodyweight crunches get too easy
Weighted ab training can help the core muscles grow and look more defined
Increases abdominal strength, not just muscle tone

name: Crunch Isometric Hold Without Dumbbell - Gethin Variation

image_src_note.title: Crunch Isometric Hold Without Dumbbell - Gethin Variation Images

name: Banded crunch isometric hold
Benefits: Great way to learn abdominal bracing
Effective build-up to hollow-body holds and other advanced isometric core moves
Helps build core strength that carries over to other training

name: Straight-arm cable pull-over
Benefits: Stretches and contracts both the lats and chest muscles
Effectively targets the lower lats at peak contraction
Easy to adjust height to match level of shoulder mobility
Cable provides constant tension throughout the movement, including at peak contraction

name: Machine Low Row
Benefits: Builds size and strength in the lower and mid back, lats, and rhomboids
Engages the core to keep good form
Machine forces you to keep strict form and control the weight

name: Slalom jumps
Benefits: Builds muscular endurance and strength in the quads, adductors, glutes, and hamstrings
Works core strength to maintain balance and upright position
Cardiovascular challenge that also builds explosiveness, balance, and coordination
Requires no equipment

name: Exercise Ball Cable Crunch - Gethin Variation

image_src_note.title: Exercise Ball Cable Crunch - Gethin Variation Images

Benefits: Targets the rectus abdominus or "six-pack" muscles
Stabilizing on the ball works the entire core
Increased range of motion compared to the floor or a bench
The better you get at it, the harder you can make every rep

name: Alternating standing knee-pull stretch
Benefits: Increases flexibility in hamstrings and hips
Pairs well with other dynamic warm-ups in a circuit
Great warm-up exercise prior to squats or deadlifts

name: Alternating standing glute stretch
Benefits: Improves flexibility and mobility in the hips and glutes
Can help reduce hip pain and muscular tightness
Stretches the piriformis muscles
If balance is an issue, can be performed while holding on to a stable object

name: Yoga plex
Benefits: Dynamic stretch for the hips and shoulders
Targets thoracic mobility and rotation
Reinforces safe spinal position for lifting and athletics
Warms up the muscles and raises core temperature

name: Bent Over Shoulder Y
Benefits: Works the oft-overlooked rear heads of shoulders
Promotes balanced shoulder development
Helps prevent shoulder injuries

name: Seal jack
Benefits: Great warm-up for exercise, sports, or just to limber up
Raises core body temperature and burns calories
Can be performed by all fitness levels

name: Dumbbell shoulder press with body rotation

image_src_note.title: Dumbbell shoulder press with body rotation Images

Benefits: Builds size and strength in the shoulders, triceps, and upper back
A neutral grip may be more shoulder-friendly than pressing with palms facing forward
Added emphasis on the core due to body rotation
Great way to make shoulder training more athletic

name: Bear crawl
Benefits: Cardiovascular and muscular challenge even with no added weight
Engrains cross-body gait pattern and athletic coordination
Challenges the shoulders, core, legs, arms, and back

name: Crab single-arm reach
Benefits: Builds muscular endurance and strength in the lower body
Stretches biceps and develops shoulder extension to maintain tabletop position
More difficult than traditional glute bridges or bodyweight hip thrusts
Great glute activation that can be done daily
Develops and maintains thoracic spine mobility

name: Dynamic pigeon stretch
Benefits: Improves flexibility and mobility in the hips and glutes
Stretches the piriformis muscles and glutes
Improved mobility in hips leads to better performance in lower-body movements

name: Exercise ball rear delt fly

image_src_note.title: Exercise ball rear delt fly Images

Benefits: Works the rear heads of the shoulders
Targets often-neglected postural muscles in the upper back
The exercise ball forces you to stabilize your core
Great as a high-rep burnout or as a warm-up for upper-body lifting

name: Ball Hamstring Hat Trick
Benefits: Builds muscle and strength in the hamstrings
Glutes and core needs to work too to keep this move stable
Great substitute for the lying leg curl machine
Excellent high-rep burnout for leg day

name: Plate push
Benefits: Little equipment needed and low risk of injury
Works the muscles of the hips, glutes, and quadriceps
Because there is no eccentric component to the movement, it results in very little muscle soreness
Serious cardiovascular challenge and calorie burn

name: Side kick-through push-up
Benefits: Builds strength and size in the shoulders and chest
Increases core strength, as well as full-body coordination and balance
Trains shoulder extension and stability
Greater challenge to the obliques than sit-through

name: Side lunge cross-body heel-touch
Benefits: Builds strength in the glutes, quads, and hamstrings
Works core strength to maintain balance and a neutral spine
Good dynamic warm-up movement prior to a workout
Trains hips outside of normal exercise plane of motion

name: Cross-over jack
Benefits: Works the abductors and adductors more than traditional jumping jacks
Burns calories and elevates heart rate
Good for warm-up sets or as a way to keep heart rate elevated between sets and exercises
Raises core temperature and mobilizes shoulders and hips before lifting or sports

name: Alligator Crawl
Benefits: Intense challenge even with no added weight
Engrains cross-body gait pattern and athletic coordination
Challenges the shoulders, core, legs, arms, and back

name: Lying cross-over lower back stretch

image_src_note.title: Lying cross-over lower back stretch Images

Benefits: Stretches hips, glutes, and lower back
Encourages thoracic spine mobility
Great warm-up prior to squats or deadlifts

name: Side-lying leg lift
Benefits: Targets the gluteus medius muscles and hip stabilizers
Can be performed by people of all fitness levels

name: Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise

Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise Instruction: 1: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Place the ball of the foot on a sturdy and stable wooden board (that is around 2-3 inches tall) while your heels extend off and touch the floor. This will be your starting position.

2: With the toes pointing either straight (to hit all parts equally), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the inner head), raise the heels off the floor as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second.
3: As you inhale, go back to the starting position by slowly lowering the heels.
4: Repeat for the recommended amount of times.

name: Speed Box Squat

Speed Box Squat Instructions: 1: Attach bands to the bar that are securely anchored near the ground. You may need to choke the bands to get adequate tension.

2: Use a box of an appropriate height for this exercise. Load the bar to a weight that still requires effort, but isn't so heavy that speed is compromised. Typically, that will be between 50-70% of your one rep max.
3: Position the bar on your upper back, shoulder blades retracted, back arched and everything tight head to toe. This will be the starting position.
4: Unrack the bar and position yourself in front of the box. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box, ensuring that you descend under control and don't crash onto the surface.
5: Pause briefly, and explode off of the box, extending through the hips and knees.

Benefits: Makes the lockout of a squat more difficult
Trains speed-strength when performed with light weights
Lightens load at the bottom of a squat, the weakest position, and increases load on the strongest

name: Toe-touch
Benefits: Strengthens the abs and hip flexors
Demands hip flexor and quad strength to keep legs straight
Constant tension on the abs throughout the movement
Requires no equipment

name: 30 Hanging Toes-To-Bar
Benefits: Builds serious core strength that carries over to a wide range of lifts
Forces coordination and co-contraction of the lats, shoulders, core, and hip flexors
Builds hamstring flexibility when done strictly
Can be trained in lower strength-focused rep ranges than many other ab exercise

name: 30 V-Up
Benefits: Strengthens the abs and hip flexors
Increases core strength and stability
More difficult than standard crunches or reverse crunches
Requires no equipment

name: Weighted sit-up
Benefits: Allows you to train in lower rep ranges when bodyweight sit-ups become too easy
Weighted ab training can help the core muscles grow and look more defined
Increases abdominal strength, not just muscle tone

name: Medicine ball twist
Benefits: Works the obliques dynamically and the rectus abdominis isometrically
Squeezing the ball co-contracts the chest, potentially making the core work harder
Pairs well with other movements in a core circuit

image_src_note.title: 30 Hanging Leg Raise With Dumbbell Images

name: Hanging exercise ball leg raise

image_src_note.title: Hanging exercise ball leg raise Images

Benefits: Higher degree of difficulty than with the captain's chair or parallel bars
Produces a major burn in the midsection
Can be performed anywhere with a bar to hang from

name: Cocoon crunch
Benefits: Builds the rectus abdominis and the obliques
Both stretches and contracts ab muscles
Difficulty increased by moving both arms and legs simultaneously
No equipment required

name: Bench oblique crunch
Benefits: Works the obliques
Easy to learn and master
The balance challenge of staying on the bench may make the core muscles work harder

name: 30 Cable Reverse Crunch On Ball

image_src_note.title: 30 Cable Reverse Crunch On Ball Images

Benefits: Building core strength and stability
Engages the low and upper back to maintain spinal stability
Cables allow for constant tension on the muscles
Using a BOSU creates more of a stabilization challenge for the core

name: Standing Low-Cable Row - Abel Albonetti Version

image_src_note.title: Standing Low-Cable Row - Abel Albonetti Version Images

name: 30 Cable Reverse Crunch
Benefits: Building core strength and stability
Engages the low and upper back to maintain spinal stability
Cables allow for constant tension on the muscles

name: Full moon-
Benefits: Added challenge beyond standard V-ups
Intense isometric and dynamic core work for rectus abdominis, or “six-pack” muscles, and obliques
Strengthens both abs and hip flexors

name: 30 Decline Press Sit-Up
Benefits: Builds strength and stability in the rectus abdominus
Builds strength and size in the deltoids
Can be progressed by increasing the decline angle over time or adding weight

name: Push-up to side plank
Benefits: Strengthens the chest, triceps, shoulders, and core
Strengthens the abdominals, mainly targeting the obliques
Improves shoulder and hip stability
